original: @175a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @175a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: aa lam bha na pa r'i ksha t'i k'a /
analyzed: aa lam bha na pa r'i ksha t'i k'a /
translated: Ālambanaparīkṣātīkā

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: dmigs pa brtag pa'i 'grel bshad /
analyzed: dmigs pa brtag pa'i 'grel bshad /
translated: Explanation of the Examination of the Object

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: thugs rjes zin pa'i dgongs pa can //
analyzed: thugs rjes zin pa'i dgongs pa can //
translated: Those who are endowed with the intention of compassion,

original: thams cad mkhyen la spyi bo yis //🔽phyag 'tshal dmigs pa brtag pa yi //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen la spyi bo yis // phyag 'tshal dmigs pa brtag pa yi //
translated: I bow my head to the Omniscient One

original: rnam par bshad pa rab tu bya //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa rab tu bya //
translated: And will thoroughly explain the commentary🔽On the Examination of the Object.

original: gang dag mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i zhes bya ba'i tshig dang po 'dis ni rab tu byed pa 'di'i brjod par bya ba dang / phyin ci log gi rgyu mtshan bstan to //
analyzed: gang dag mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i zhes bya ba'i tshig dang po 'dis ni rab tu byed pa 'di'i brjod par bya ba dang / phyin ci log gi rgyu mtshan bstan to //
translated: By the first phrase, “The consciousnesses of the eye and so on,” the topic and the reason for error are taught in this treatise.

original: dgos pa dang 'brel pa dag ni shugs kyis dpag par bya ste /
analyzed: dgos pa dang 'brel pa dag ni shugs kyis dpag par bya ste /
translated: The purpose and the connection are to be inferred by implication.

original: shugs kyang skabs su bab nas bstan par bya'o /
analyzed: shugs kyang skabs su bab nas bstan par bya'o /
translated: And the implication will be taught as it occurs.

original: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'brel pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang dgos pa rnams ni gdon mi za bar brjod dgos so //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'brel pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang dgos pa rnams ni gdon mi za bar brjod dgos so //
translated: The connection, the topic, and the purpose of this treatise must certainly be stated.

original: de lta ma yin na 'brel pa med pa dang brjod par bya ba med pa dang dgos pa med pa'i rab tu byed pa ni nyan pa po rtog pa sngon du gtong ba dag khas mi len to //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'brel pa med pa dang brjod par bya ba med pa dang dgos pa med pa'i rab tu byed pa ni nyan pa po rtog pa sngon du gtong ba dag khas mi len to //
translated: Otherwise, the treatise would be without a connection, without a subject matter, and without a purpose, and those who listen to it would not accept it, since it would be without a purpose.

original: de lta bas na 'dir gang dag mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa phyi rol gyi don yin par 'dod pa de dag rdul phra rab rnams yin pa'am /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir gang dag mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa phyi rol gyi don yin par 'dod pa de dag rdul phra rab rnams yin pa'am /
translated: Therefore, here, those who assert that the object of observation of eye consciousness, etc. is an external object, imagine that it is the subtle particles or that it is a composite of those.

original: de 'dus pa yin par rtog grang na zhes bya ba 'dis ni spang bar bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi brjod par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: de 'dus pa yin par rtog grang na zhes bya ba 'dis ni spang bar bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi brjod par bya ba bstan to //
translated: This is the statement of the nature of the object of abandonment.

original: de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / der snang ba'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyin ci log gi rgyu mtshan bstan to //
analyzed: de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / der snang ba'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyin ci log gi rgyu mtshan bstan to //
translated: The reason is because it is the cause of that and because a consciousness appearing as that is produced. This is the statement of the reason for the error.

original: dgos pa dang 'brel ba bdag ni shugs kyis bstan to //
analyzed: dgos pa dang 'brel ba bdag ni shugs kyis bstan to //
translated: The connection with the purpose is implicitly taught.

original: de la shugs @175b ni 'di yin par khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: de la shugs @175b ni 'di yin par khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: The implicit meaning should be understood as follows.

original: phyi rol gyi dmigs pa dag dgag pa'i phyir dang / nang gi rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di brtsam mo //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dmigs pa dag dgag pa'i phyir dang / nang gi rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di brtsam mo //
translated: This chapter is composed in order to refute external objects and to establish the internal.

original: de lta bas na phyi dang nang gi don dag dgag pa dang / rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di rtsom pas shugs kyis na 'gog pa dang rab tu sgrub pa dag ni dgos pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na phyi dang nang gi don dag dgag pa dang / rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di rtsom pas shugs kyis na 'gog pa dang rab tu sgrub pa dag ni dgos pa nyid yin la /
translated: Thus, since this chapter is composed in order to refute external objects and to establish internal objects, implicitly, refutation and establishment are the purpose,

original: rab tu byed pa ni thabs nyid yin par bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa ni thabs nyid yin par bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: and the chapter is the means.

original: 'di ltar rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams ni dgos pa med pa la yang 'jug par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams ni dgos pa med pa la yang 'jug par mi 'gyur la /
translated: For, those who proceed with an idea do not engage in what is purposeless,

original: thabs ma yin pa la yang ma yin no //🔽'dir rigs pas phyi rol gyi dmigs pa dgag pa dang / nang gi rab tu sgrub pa 'di ni brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: thabs ma yin pa la yang ma yin no // 'dir rigs pas phyi rol gyi dmigs pa dgag pa dang / nang gi rab tu sgrub pa 'di ni brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: nor in what is not a means.🔽Here, the refutation of external objects and the establishment of the internal by means of reasoning are to be stated.

original: de nyid 'gog pa dang rab tu sgrub pa dag ni dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid 'gog pa dang rab tu sgrub pa dag ni dgos pa yin no //
translated: Refutation and establishment are the purpose.

original: dgos pa de yang rab tu byed pa 'dis byed pas rab tu byed pa ni dgos pa 'di'i thabs yin no //
analyzed: dgos pa de yang rab tu byed pa 'dis byed pas rab tu byed pa ni dgos pa 'di'i thabs yin no //
translated: Since this chapter also performs that function, this chapter is the means for that purpose.

original: de'i phyir rab tu byed pa dang / dgos pa dag thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rab tu byed pa dang / dgos pa dag thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the chapter and the purpose are related by the characteristic of means and that which arises from the means.

original: de ltar bas na phyi dang nang gi don dag dgag pa dang / rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir rab byed pa 'di brtsam mo zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de ltar bas na phyi dang nang gi don dag dgag pa dang / rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir rab byed pa 'di brtsam mo zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Thus, this chapter is composed in order to refute and prove external and internal objects.

original: de ltar gnas pa la brgya la 'ga' zhig 'gog pa dang / rab tu sgrub pa 'di dag gis ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa la brgya la 'ga' zhig 'gog pa dang / rab tu sgrub pa 'di dag gis ci zhig bya ste /
translated: If someone were to ask, “What is the use of this refutation and proof?

original: de dag ni gang du yang mi mkho'o zhes gleng bar byed na 'dir smras pa /🔽dor ba dang / blang ba dag 'gog pa dang rab tu sgrub par byed pa gang dag yod pa de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni gang du yang mi mkho'o zhes gleng bar byed na 'dir smras pa / dor ba dang / blang ba dag 'gog pa dang rab tu sgrub par byed pa gang dag yod pa de dag ni /
translated: They are not necessary anywhere,” we would reply as follows.🔽Those who refute and prove the rejection and acceptance of those two

original: de gnyis 'dor ba dang len par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis 'dor ba dang len par byed pa yin no //
translated: are the ones who reject and accept those two.

original: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi don dor bar bya ba'i phyir 'gog par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi don dor bar bya ba'i phyir 'gog par byed de /
translated: Thus, one refutes external objects in order to discard them.

original: ci nas kyang 'gog pa las phyi rol gyi don dor bar bya ba nyid yin par shes nas dor bar bya'o snyam ste 'gog par byed do //🔽de bzhin du rab tu sgrub pa las nang gi don blang bar bya ba nyid yin pa shes nas blang bar bya'o snyam ste /
analyzed: ci nas kyang 'gog pa las phyi rol gyi don dor bar bya ba nyid yin par shes nas dor bar bya'o snyam ste 'gog par byed do // de bzhin du rab tu sgrub pa las nang gi don blang bar bya ba nyid yin pa shes nas blang bar bya'o snyam ste /
translated: One refutes them thinking, “Having understood that external objects are to be discarded from the negation, I will discard them.”🔽Similarly, one establishes internal objects in order to adopt them.

original: rab tu sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: rab tu sgrub par byed do //
translated: One establishes them thinking, “Having understood that internal objects are to be adopted, I will adopt them.”

original: de bas na phyi dang nang dor bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba dag dor par bya ba dang blang ba'i phyir 'gog pa dang / rab tu sgrub par byed pas dgos pa yang bshad pa yin yin no //
analyzed: de bas na phyi dang nang dor bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba dag dor par bya ba dang blang ba'i phyir 'gog pa dang / rab tu sgrub par byed pas dgos pa yang bshad pa yin yin no //
translated: Thus the purpose of negation and establishment is to discard and adopt external and internal objects.

original: de lta na 'o na ni ji ltar tshig dang po 'dis spang bar bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi brjod par bya ba bstan pa de bzhin du /🔽blang bar bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo yang bstan @176a * //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni ji ltar tshig dang po 'dis spang bar bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi brjod par bya ba bstan pa de bzhin du / blang bar bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo yang bstan @176a * //
translated: If that is so, then just as the first statement teaches the object of expression that is to be discarded,

original: dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: dgos so zhe na /
translated: it must also teach the nature of that which is to be adopted.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba rnams ni phyi rol gyi don du yongs su rtogs pas shin tu gnod de /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba rnams ni phyi rol gyi don du yongs su rtogs pas shin tu gnod de /
translated: Those who advocate external objects are very much mistaken, because they imagine external objects.

original: de'i phyir de kho na tshig dang pos bstan nas gtsod de dag dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho na tshig dang pos bstan nas gtsod de dag dgag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, we will teach reality with the first verse and refute those who advocate external objects.

original: phyis ni zhar la /
analyzed: phyis ni zhar la /
translated: Later, we will deal with the other issues.

original: nang gi ngo bo'i shes bya ni //
analyzed: nang gi ngo bo'i shes bya ni //
translated: The internal object of knowledge

original: phyi rol ltar snang gang yin te //
analyzed: phyi rol ltar snang gang yin te //
translated: appears as if it were external.

original: don yin zhes bya ba 'dis nang gi len par byed de /
analyzed: don yin zhes bya ba 'dis nang gi len par byed de /
translated: The word “object” is used to refer to the internal object.

original: re zhig 'di ni spyi'i don yin no //
analyzed: re zhig 'di ni spyi'i don yin no //
translated: This is the general meaning.

original: yan lag gi don brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yan lag gi don brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now we will explain the specific meaning.

original: gang dag mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni rgol ba ril gyis dmigs pa phyi rol gyi don yin par 'dod pa ni ma yin pas de'i phyir gang dag ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gang dag mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni rgol ba ril gyis dmigs pa phyi rol gyi don yin par 'dod pa ni ma yin pas de'i phyir gang dag ces bya ba smos so //
translated: The phrase “those who advocate” does not refer to all opponents who advocate that the eye consciousness and so on have external objects as their objects.

original: dbang po gang dag la mig la sogs pa yod pa de dag ni mig la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po gang dag la mig la sogs pa yod pa de dag ni mig la sogs pa ste /
translated: Those who have eyes and so on are those who have eyes and so on.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni rna ba la sogs pa yid la thug pa'i bar gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni rna ba la sogs pa yid la thug pa'i bar gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes the ear and so on up to the mind.

original: 'di ltar yid kyang phyi ral gyi don gyi dmigs pa can du 'dod pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar yid kyang phyi ral gyi don gyi dmigs pa can du 'dod pa nyid de /
translated: The mind is also accepted as having an external object as its object.

original: de'i phyir de'i dmigs pa yang 'dir tshar gcig tu dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i dmigs pa yang 'dir tshar gcig tu dgag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, its object is refuted here in one fell swoop.

original: de gzhag pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: de gzhag pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What is the point of positing it?

original: bstan bcos byed pa gang gis ni de gzhag par bya ba de'i yul logs shig tu 'gog par ni mi byed do //
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pa gang gis ni de gzhag par bya ba de'i yul logs shig tu 'gog par ni mi byed do //
translated: The author of the treatise does not refute the object of that mind in a separate section, since he posits it.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon chos skyong gis rang gi 'grel bshad las /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon chos skyong gis rang gi 'grel bshad las /
translated: Therefore the master Dharmottara says in his commentary:

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa gzhag pa'i phyir mang po zhig smos pa gang yin pa de ni de nyid shes grang /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa gzhag pa'i phyir mang po zhig smos pa gang yin pa de ni de nyid shes grang /
translated: “The many statements that posit the object of mental consciousness are for the sake of understanding that.

original: bdag gis ni de'i bsam pa zab pa'i phyir mi rig go //🔽mig la sogs pa dag gi rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: bdag gis ni de'i bsam pa zab pa'i phyir mi rig go // mig la sogs pa dag gi rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: I do not understand the intention of that master.🔽The consciousness of the eye and so on

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: is the consciousness of the eye and so on.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam pa mang po nyid kho nas rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa yang mang ba nyid du bstan par 'gyur bas rnam par shes pa la mang po'i tshig bstan par bya ste dper na /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam pa mang po nyid kho nas rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa yang mang ba nyid du bstan par 'gyur bas rnam par shes pa la mang po'i tshig bstan par bya ste dper na /
translated: The many aspects of consciousness are taught to be many because of the many aspects of the eye, etc. Therefore, the word “many” should be applied to consciousness, just as

original: zangs dang lo ma dag la dmar por gyur pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //🔽dmigs pa phyi rol gyi don zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zangs dang lo ma dag la dmar por gyur pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o // dmigs pa phyi rol gyi don zhes bya ba la /
translated: in the expression “the redness of copper and leaves.”🔽The object is an external object.

original: phyi rol gyi don ni phyi rol gyi ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don ni phyi rol gyi ste /
translated: An external object is an object external to consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa lam gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lam gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the phrase “apart from consciousness.”

original: rtogs par bya bas na don te shes par bya zhing gzung bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtogs par bya bas na don te shes par bya zhing gzung bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: An object is that which is to be realized, that is, it is that which is to be known and grasped.

original: don zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir yul gyi rnam grangs yin par bstan par bya'i rdzas yod par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir yul gyi rnam grangs yin par bstan par bya'i rdzas yod par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The word “object” here is shown to be a synonym for “object-field,” not a synonym for “substantial reality.”

original: @176b 'di ltar 'dus pa yang yul nyid du 'chad par 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: @176b 'di ltar 'dus pa yang yul nyid du 'chad par 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: Thus, a collection is also an object-field,

original: 'di rdzas su yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di rdzas su yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not a substantial reality.

original: dmigs pa yin par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni gzung ba yin par khas len pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs pa yin par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni gzung ba yin par khas len pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “they assert that it is the object of perception” means that they accept that it is the object of apprehension.

original: de dag rdul phra rab dag yin pa 'am zhes bya ba ni rgol ba de dag rnam par shes pa'i yul rdul shin tu phra ba dag yin par khas len par 'gyur ba 'am zhes bya'o //🔽de dag ni rdul yang yin la phra rab kyang yin pas /
analyzed: de dag rdul phra rab dag yin pa 'am zhes bya ba ni rgol ba de dag rnam par shes pa'i yul rdul shin tu phra ba dag yin par khas len par 'gyur ba 'am zhes bya'o // de dag ni rdul yang yin la phra rab kyang yin pas /
translated: The phrase “they are subtle particles” means that these opponents accept that the object of consciousness is subtle particles.🔽They are particles and they are subtle.

original: rdul phra rab dag ste /
analyzed: rdul phra rab dag ste /
translated: Therefore, they are subtle particles.

original: gang phan chad ches phra ba gzhan med pa'i phyir shin tu phra mo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang phan chad ches phra ba gzhan med pa'i phyir shin tu phra mo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are called subtle particles because they are the most subtle, that is, they are the most subtle because there are no other particles that are smaller than they are.

original: rdul phra rab 'dus pa kho na skye zhing 'gag mod kyi /
analyzed: rdul phra rab 'dus pa kho na skye zhing 'gag mod kyi /
translated: Only the aggregation of subtle particles arises and ceases.

original: 'on kyang gzhan dag 'di dag 'dus pa re re yang dmigs pa nyid yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan dag 'di dag 'dus pa re re yang dmigs pa nyid yin par 'dod de /
translated: However, others assert that each individual aggregation is the object of perception.

original: ji ltar dbang po rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir gzugs dang ro la sogs pa gcig tu 'dus pa dag kyang so sor nges pa'i dbang po'i gzung ba yin pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang rdzas yongs su gcod pa la nus pa
analyzed: ji ltar dbang po rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir gzugs dang ro la sogs pa gcig tu 'dus pa dag kyang so sor nges pa'i dbang po'i gzung ba yin pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang rdzas yongs su gcod pa la nus pa
translated: Just as form, taste, and so on are the objects of the individual sense faculties because the potency of the sense faculties is individually certain, so too consciousness is the apprehender of substance because its potency is individually certain.🔽

original: nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nges pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as form, taste, etc., which are one in substance, are the apprehended objects of the individual sense faculties because the power of the sense faculties is individually determined, so too consciousness is the object of apprehension of the sense faculty of touch because the power of consciousness is determined in the complete determination of substance.

original: rdul re re zhing dmigs pa yin gyi spyi ni ma yin no zhes grag go //
analyzed: rdul re re zhing dmigs pa yin gyi spyi ni ma yin no zhes grag go //
translated: Therefore, each atom is the object of apprehension of the sense faculty of touch.🔽Even if they are composite, how can those extremely subtle atoms be apprehended?

original: 'dus pa yin du zin kyang 'on kyang shin tu phra mo de dag ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dus pa yin du zin kyang 'on kyang shin tu phra mo de dag ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “because they are the cause of that.”

original: de dag phra mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag phra mod kyi /
translated: Although they are subtle,

original: 'on kyang gang gi phyir rdzas su yod pas rnam par shes pa'i rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur ba de'i phyir dmigs par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang gi phyir rdzas su yod pas rnam par shes pa'i rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur ba de'i phyir dmigs par 'dod do //
translated: because they exist as substances, they become the cause of consciousness. Therefore they are asserted to be objects of apprehension.

original: 'di'i bsam pa ni dmigs pa'i don ni rgyu'i don to snyam pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i bsam pa ni dmigs pa'i don ni rgyu'i don to snyam pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the term “object of apprehension” is the meaning of “cause.”

original: rkyen rnams ni nang du dmigs pa bstan pa'i phyir dang / rkyen yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen rnams ni nang du dmigs pa bstan pa'i phyir dang / rkyen yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Conditions are the cause of consciousness because they are taught as the internal object and because conditions are causes.

original: rgyu nyid yin pa 'di yang gzhan gyi ltar rdul phra rab rnams dmigs pa nyid du yongs su brtag pa la phyin ci log gi rgyu mtshan yin te /
analyzed: rgyu nyid yin pa 'di yang gzhan gyi ltar rdul phra rab rnams dmigs pa nyid du yongs su brtag pa la phyin ci log gi rgyu mtshan yin te /
translated: This is the cause of consciousness, and it is the reason for the error in the other’s theory that the subtle atoms are the object.

original: 'di ltar de dag rnam par shes pa'i rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur ba na phyi rol gyi don du smra ba rnams dmigs pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag rnam par shes pa'i rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur ba na phyi rol gyi don du smra ba rnams dmigs pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: In that case, the subtle atoms would be the cause of consciousness, and the proponents of external objects would assert that they are the object.

original: de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they are the cause of that.

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rnam par shes pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rnam par shes pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word “that” is connected with “consciousness.”

original: phyogs gnyis pa nye bar dgod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa nye bar dgod pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to present the second position, he says,

original: de 'dus pa yin par rtog grang na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de 'dus pa yin par rtog grang na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “If you imagine that it is the aggregation of those.”

original: rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa rdul phra rab 'dus pa yin par rtog grang na'o //🔽de dag @177a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa rdul phra rab 'dus pa yin par rtog grang na'o // de dag @177a * //
translated: If you imagine that the object of consciousness is the aggregation of subtle atoms,🔽then those

original: 'dus pa ni de 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa ni de 'dus pa'o //
translated: are the aggregation of those.

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'dir rdul phra rab dag dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'dir rdul phra rab dag dang sbyar te /
translated: The word “that” refers to the atoms.

original: des na rdul phra rab 'dus pa zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rdul phra rab 'dus pa zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the compound “aggregate of atoms” is explained.

original: yang ci'i phyir de dag 'dus pa dmigs pa yin par 'dod ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir de dag 'dus pa dmigs pa yin par 'dod ce na /
translated: Why is the aggregate of atoms considered to be the perceived object?

original: der snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: der snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, “because consciousness arises appearing as that.”

original: gang gi phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rtag tu 'dus par snang bar skye ba de'i phyir 'dus pa dmigs par 'dod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rtag tu 'dus par snang bar skye ba de'i phyir 'dus pa dmigs par 'dod do //
translated: The visual consciousness, etc., always arise appearing as an aggregate. Therefore, the aggregate is considered to be the perceived object.

original: 'dir yang 'dus pa dmigs pa nyid yin par yongs su brtag pa la phyin ci log gi rgyu mtshan ni 'dus par snang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang 'dus pa dmigs pa nyid yin par yongs su brtag pa la phyin ci log gi rgyu mtshan ni 'dus par snang ba nyid yin no //
translated: In this context, the reason for the error in the assumption that the aggregate is the perceived object is that it appears as an aggregate.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa 'dus par snang ba de'i phyir gzhan 'dus pa dmigs pa yin no snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa 'dus par snang ba de'i phyir gzhan 'dus pa dmigs pa yin no snyam du sems te /
translated: The visual consciousness, etc., appear as an aggregate. Therefore, the other, the aggregate, is the perceived object.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa gang ltar snang bar skye bde ni de'i yul yin par 'dod do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa gang ltar snang bar skye bde ni de'i yul yin par 'dod do zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus, whatever form consciousness arises in that aspect, that is asserted to be its object.

original: rnam par shes pa 'di la de lta bur snang ba yod pas 'di ni der snang ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di la de lta bur snang ba yod pas 'di ni der snang ba'o //
translated: Since this consciousness appears in that way, it appears as that.

original: 'dir yang der zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'dus pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang der zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'dus pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: Here, the word “that” is connected with “aggregation.”

original: de ni der snang ba yang yin la rnam par shes pa yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: de ni der snang ba yang yin la rnam par shes pa yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: Since it is both that appearance and consciousness, the words are connected in this way.

original: der snang ba'i shes pa skye ba zhes tshig bsdu'o //
analyzed: der snang ba'i shes pa skye ba zhes tshig bsdu'o //
translated: The compound “arising of the consciousness that appears as that” is contracted.

original: de ltar na 'dir gzhan dag dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'thad pa'i phyir rdul phra rab dang / 'dus pa dag dmigs pa nyid yin no snyam du sems so zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir gzhan dag dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'thad pa'i phyir rdul phra rab dang / 'dus pa dag dmigs pa nyid yin no snyam du sems so zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma yin no //
translated: Thus, since the characteristic of perception is tenable in this way, others think that atoms and their aggregation are the perceived object. This is the opponent’s position.🔽To refute that position,

original: de la re zhig phyogs snga ma bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig phyogs snga ma bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: the root text says:

original: dbang po'i rnam par rig pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par rig pa'i rgyu //
translated: The cause of the sense consciousness

original: phra rab rdul dag yin mod kyi //
analyzed: phra rab rdul dag yin mod kyi //
translated: is indeed the subtle particles.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thus, the opponent’s position is stated.

original: rdul phra rab rnams ni yang dag pa'i don du na rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams ni yang dag pa'i don du na rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The atoms do not exist substantially in reality,

original: cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du rtog na ni kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du rtog na ni kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: because if they are imagined to have parts, it follows that they exist conventionally,

original: cha shas med pa nyid du rtog na yang grib ma dang sgrib pa la sogs pa med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: cha shas med pa nyid du rtog na yang grib ma dang sgrib pa la sogs pa med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: and if they are imagined to be partless, it follows that they are devoid of shade, obstruction, and so on.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag rgyu nyid lta ga la yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag rgyu nyid lta ga la yin /
translated: So how could they be causes?

original: 'on kyang rdul phra rab rnams rgyu nyid du khas blangs nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang rdul phra rab rnams rgyu nyid du khas blangs nas /
translated: But if you accept that atoms are causes,

original: dmigs pa nyid yin pa dag go //
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid yin pa dag go //
translated: then they are objects.

original: rdul phra rab rnams rnam par shes pa'i rgyu'i ngo bor 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams rnam par shes pa'i rgyu'i ngo bor 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: Atoms may be the cause of consciousness,

original: 'on kyang gang gi phyir de dag rdul phra rab kyi rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa mi skye ba de'i phyir dmigs @177b pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang gi phyir de dag rdul phra rab kyi rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa mi skye ba de'i phyir dmigs @177b pa ma yin te /
translated: but because they do not produce a consciousness that has the aspect of atoms, they are not objects,

original: dper na dbang po bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dbang po bzhin no //
translated: just like the sense faculties.

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur mod kyi de de'i yul yin par ni pha rol po mi 'dod do //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur mod kyi de de'i yul yin par ni pha rol po mi 'dod do //
translated: although it is the cause of the sense consciousness, the opponent does not accept that it is the object of that consciousness.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa dbang po'i rnam pa can du mi skye bas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa dbang po'i rnam pa can du mi skye bas so //
translated: This is because the consciousness does not arise in the aspect of the sense faculty.

original: dbang po'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The cognition of the sense faculty.

original: dbang po smos pas ni yid la thug pa'i bar dbang po drug car gzung ste /
analyzed: dbang po smos pas ni yid la thug pa'i bar dbang po drug car gzung ste /
translated: The mention of the sense faculty includes the six sense faculties up to the mind faculty.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs ni bshad zin to //
translated: The reason has already been explained.

original: phra rab rdul dag ces bya ba 'di ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: phra rab rdul dag ces bya ba 'di ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The phrase “the subtle particles” is self-evident.

original: yin mod kyi zhes bya ba 'dis ni khas len pa'i rgol ba ston te /
analyzed: yin mod kyi zhes bya ba 'dis ni khas len pa'i rgol ba ston te /
translated: The word “although” indicates that the opponent accepts this.

original: der mi snang phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: der mi snang phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they do not appear there.

original: gang la de dag lta bur snang ba yod pa de ni der snang ba ste /
analyzed: gang la de dag lta bur snang ba yod pa de ni der snang ba ste /
translated: That which has the appearance of those is the appearance there.

original: der zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rdul phra rab dag dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rdul phra rab dag dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word “there” is connected with the subtle particles.

original: der mi snang ba ni der mi snang ba ste /
analyzed: der mi snang ba ni der mi snang ba ste /
translated: They do not appear there.

original: gsum pa ni 'dir gtan tshigs la blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni 'dir gtan tshigs la blta bar bya ste /
translated: The third reason should be understood as the reason here.

original: de bas rdul phra rab kyi rnam pa can ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas rdul phra rab kyi rnam pa can ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the object is not in the form of atoms.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rnam par rig pa'i'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rnam par rig pa'i'o //
translated: “ That” refers to the sense-perception.

original: yul ni / rdul phran ma yin dbang po bzhin //
analyzed: yul ni / rdul phran ma yin dbang po bzhin //
translated: The object is not an atom, like the sense-faculties.

original: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dbang po rnams yul ma yin pa ltar rdul phra rab rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dbang po rnams yul ma yin pa ltar rdul phra rab rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Just as the sense-faculties are not the object, so also the atoms are not. This is the meaning.

original: dbang po zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'dir dbang byed pa rnams brjod do //
analyzed: dbang po zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'dir dbang byed pa rnams brjod do //
translated: The word “sense-faculty” here refers to the controlling faculties.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa rdul phra rab kyi rnam pa can du ma gyur na de ni de nyid kyis nyes par 'gyur grang /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa rdul phra rab kyi rnam pa can du ma gyur na de ni de nyid kyis nyes par 'gyur grang /
translated: If consciousness were not in the form of atoms, then that would be a fault.

original: rdul phra rab rnams go skyid par byed pa yin bzhin du /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams go skyid par byed pa yin bzhin du /
translated: The atoms are arranged in a pleasing manner.

original: ci'i phyir yul du mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yul du mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why are they not the object?

original: de'i phyir yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said “the object, etc.”

original: 'di ltar yul ni gang gi rang gi ngo bo de'i rnam par skye bar nges par 'dzin pa de la bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar yul ni gang gi rang gi ngo bo de'i rnam par skye bar nges par 'dzin pa de la bya'o //
translated: Thus, the object is that which is ascertained as the nature of which the consciousness is born in the aspect of that.

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “only” means “just.”

original: rang gi ngo bo des par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo des par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Ascertaining its nature.

original: rang gi ngo bo smos pas ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo smos pas ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The word “nature” is meant to include both the particular and the universal characteristics.

original: de nges par 'dzin pa ni rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de nges par 'dzin pa ni rtog pa ste /
translated: Ascertaining it is the conception.

original: yongs su gcod cing 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yongs su gcod cing 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for determining and apprehending.

original: de'i rnam par skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yul gyi rnam par skye ba ma gtogs par gzhan du rnam par shes pas yul nges par gzung bar mi nus te /🔽de'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par skye ba'i rnam par shes @178a * //
analyzed: de'i rnam par skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yul gyi rnam par skye ba ma gtogs par gzhan du rnam par shes pas yul nges par gzung bar mi nus te / de'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par skye ba'i rnam par shes @178a * //
translated: Because it is born in its aspect. The object cannot be ascertained by consciousness except through the consciousness’s being born in the aspect of the object.

original: pas sngon po la sogs pa'i don nges par 'dzin to zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pas sngon po la sogs pa'i don nges par 'dzin to zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the object, such as blue, is ascertained by the consciousness that is born in the aspect of blue.

original: 'di la gang zhig byed na /
analyzed: 'di la gang zhig byed na /
translated: What is the function of this consciousness?

original: rnam par shes pa 'dis yul nges par 'dzin to zhes tha snyad gdags par bya ba nges par 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi byed pa ni 'ga' tsam yang med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'dis yul nges par 'dzin to zhes tha snyad gdags par bya ba nges par 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi byed pa ni 'ga' tsam yang med do //
translated: There is not the slightest activity that has the characteristic of apprehending a particular object, as in the convention “This consciousness apprehends an object.”

original: ji ltar ba'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed par skye ba'i bus pha'i gzugs 'dzin to zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar ba'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed par skye ba'i bus pha'i gzugs 'dzin to zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as it is said that a son who is born in the likeness of his father “resembles” his father,

original: rnam par shes pa yul gyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed par skye bas kyang yul 'dzin to zhes tha snyad gdags so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yul gyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed par skye bas kyang yul 'dzin to zhes tha snyad gdags so //
translated: in the same way, it is said in conventional terms that consciousness “apprehends” an object when it is born in the likeness of the object.

original: de la 'di snyam du rdul phra rab rnams kyi yang de bzhin du de'i rnam par skye bas rang gi ngo bo nges par 'dzin to snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du rdul phra rab rnams kyi yang de bzhin du de'i rnam par skye bas rang gi ngo bo nges par 'dzin to snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that the atoms of the object are apprehended in the same way, because they are born in the likeness of the object,

original: de'i phyir rdul phra mo dag ni de'i rgyu nyid yin du zin kyang de lta ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rdul phra mo dag ni de'i rgyu nyid yin du zin kyang de lta ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then we reply that even though the atoms are the cause of the consciousness, they are not like the object.

original: rdul phra rab rnams ni de'i rgyu nyid yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams ni de'i rgyu nyid yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even though the atoms are the cause of the consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa so sor nges pa'i rnam pa'i rjes su mi byed na de ni ji ltar de dag gi rang gi ngo bo 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa so sor nges pa'i rnam pa'i rjes su mi byed na de ni ji ltar de dag gi rang gi ngo bo 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: If consciousness does not conform to the specific aspects of the object, how can it apprehend the object’s own nature?

original: nges par mi 'dzin na yang ji ltar yul du 'gyur /
analyzed: nges par mi 'dzin na yang ji ltar yul du 'gyur /
translated: And if it does not apprehend the object’s own nature, how can the object be an object of consciousness?

original: de'i rgyu nyid yin du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin du zin kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i rgyu nyid yin du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin du zin kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Even if it were the cause of consciousness, the phrase “even if it were the cause of consciousness” means “even if it were the cause of consciousness.”

original: 'dir dper dbang po bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /🔽ji ltar dbang po rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur yang /
analyzed: 'dir dper dbang po bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te / ji ltar dbang po rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur yang /
translated: The root text states, “For example, it is like the sense faculties.”

original: de'i rnam par skye ba'i rnam par shes pas rang gi ngo bo nges par mi 'dzin pas /
analyzed: de'i rnam par skye ba'i rnam par shes pas rang gi ngo bo nges par mi 'dzin pas /
translated: Even though the sense faculties are the cause of consciousness, the consciousness that arises in their aspect does not apprehend their own nature.

original: yul nyid du mi 'dod pa ltar rdul phra rab rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yul nyid du mi 'dod pa ltar rdul phra rab rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the sense faculties are not considered to be objects of consciousness. The same should be recognized as true of the most subtle particles.

original: dbang po yang dmigs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas dmigs pa ni rgyu mtshan nyid tsam 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po yang dmigs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas dmigs pa ni rgyu mtshan nyid tsam 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: The sense faculties are not considered to be objects of consciousness because it would be absurd to maintain that they are objects of their own individual forms of consciousness.

original: de ltar rdul phra rab rnams dmigs pa nyid yin pa bkag nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rdul phra rab rnams dmigs pa nyid yin pa bkag nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus refuted the fact that the subtle atoms are the perceptual object, he concludes:

original: de ltar na re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, first of all, etc.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir rdul phra rab rnams dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir rdul phra rab rnams dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since they are not suitable as the characteristic of the perceptual object, the subtle atoms are not the perceptual object, is what is meant.

original: 'dir sbyor ba ni rdul phra rab rnams dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba ni rdul phra rab rnams dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Here the syllogism is: The subtle atoms are not the perceptual object,

original: rang snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir dbang po bzhin no //
analyzed: rang snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir dbang po bzhin no //
translated: because they do not generate the consciousness that perceives them, like the sense faculties.

original: chos mi mthun pa ni gzung ba'i cha'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa ni gzung ba'i cha'o //
translated: The dissimilar instance is the apprehended part.

original: rang snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin pa yang dmigs pa nyid yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o//
analyzed: rang snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin pa yang dmigs pa nyid yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o//
translated: If that which does not generate the consciousness that perceives it were the perceptual object, there would be the absurd consequence that everything would be the perceptual object, and this is the validating cognition that refutes it.

original: @178b yang na rdul phra rab rnams ni dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: @178b yang na rdul phra rab rnams ni dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Or, the syllogism is: The subtle atoms are not the perceptual object,

original: rang gi ngo bo nges par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dbang po bzhin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nges par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dbang po bzhin no //
translated: because they do not definitely apprehend their own nature, like the sense faculties.

original: chos mi mthun pa ni gzung ba'i cha ste /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa ni gzung ba'i cha ste /
translated: The dissimilar dharma is the objective aspect.

original: gzung ba'i cha dmigs pa nyid yin par ni sgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzung ba'i cha dmigs pa nyid yin par ni sgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The objective aspect is the observed object.

original: rang gi ngo bo nges par mi 'dzin pa yang dmigs pa nyid yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nges par mi 'dzin pa yang dmigs pa nyid yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
translated: If the observed object were the observed object itself, then there would be an absurd consequence. The valid cognition that refutes that is the nonapprehension of intrinsic reality.

original: sbyor ba 'di gnyis ni slob dpon chos skyong gi bshad pa bdag gis bris kyi rang gi bshad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba 'di gnyis ni slob dpon chos skyong gi bshad pa bdag gis bris kyi rang gi bshad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: I have written these two syllogisms from the explanation of Master Dharmottara, but they are not my own explanation.

original: de ltar na re zhig rdul phra rab rnams dmigs pa nyid yin pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig rdul phra rab rnams dmigs pa nyid yin pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: Thus, first the observed object of the subtle particles is refuted.

original: 'dus pa yang dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dus pa yang dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the aggregation, he says,

original: 'dus pa der snang ba nyid yin du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dus pa der snang ba nyid yin du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Even if the aggregation were to appear there.

original: rnam par rig pa 'dus pa can du snang mod kyi /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa 'dus pa can du snang mod kyi /
translated: The aggregation appears as the cognition,

original: 'on kyang 'dus pa dmigs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dus pa dmigs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but the aggregation is not the observed object.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rig pa de de las mi skye bas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rig pa de de las mi skye bas so //
translated: Because that cognition does not arise from that.

original: de las mi skyer chug na yang dmigs bar go ci'i phyir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las mi skyer chug na yang dmigs bar go ci'i phyir mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even if it were not produced from that, why would it not be the object?

original: de'i phyir don gang zhig rang snang ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don gang zhig rang snang ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “That object which appears to it, etc.”

original: 'di ltar don gang zhig rang snang ste bdag nyid du snang ba'i rnam par rig pa skyed pa de ni dmigs pa yin par rung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar don gang zhig rang snang ste bdag nyid du snang ba'i rnam par rig pa skyed pa de ni dmigs pa yin par rung ngo //
translated: Thus, it is reasonable that the object which appears to it, i.e., appears as itself, is the objective condition of the consciousness that is produced by it.

original: 'di skad du rnam par shes pa don gang zhig gi ngo bo'i rjes su byed la /
analyzed: 'di skad du rnam par shes pa don gang zhig gi ngo bo'i rjes su byed la /
translated: This is what is being said: Consciousness is the cause of the appearance of an object, and that object is the cause of the production of consciousness.

original: de yang skyed par byed pa yin na de'i tshe dmigs pa'i rkyen du rung gi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang skyed par byed pa yin na de'i tshe dmigs pa'i rkyen du rung gi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: If that is so, then it is reasonable that it is the objective condition, but not otherwise.

original: skyed par byed pa kho na dmigs pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa kho na dmigs pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is it that only that which produces is the objective condition?

original: 'di ltar de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “For, it is said in the treatise, etc.”

original: 'di ltar de ni bstan bcos las skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni bstan bcos las skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid du bshad do //
translated: Thus, it is said in the treatise that the characteristic of the cause of production is the objective condition.

original: bstan bcos las ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: bstan bcos las ni 'di skad du /
translated: In the treatise, it is stated:

original: don gang zhig sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yang yin la /
analyzed: don gang zhig sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yang yin la /
translated: The object is the reason why minds and mental factors arise.🔽When they arise, the convention of experiencing that object is also applied.

original: de rnams skyes na don de nyams su myong ba'i tha snyad 'dogs par yang byed pa de ni dmigs pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de rnams skyes na don de nyams su myong ba'i tha snyad 'dogs par yang byed pa de ni dmigs pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: This is called the object of observation.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: don gang zhig sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skyed par byed la /
analyzed: don gang zhig sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skyed par byed la /
translated: The object is that which generates minds and mental factors.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba de rnams skyes nas /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba de rnams skyes nas /
translated: When those minds and mental factors arise,

original: don de la 'di ltar nyams su myong ngo zhes de lta bu'i tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa'i don de ni @179a * //
analyzed: don de la 'di ltar nyams su myong ngo zhes de lta bu'i tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa'i don de ni @179a * //
translated: the convention of experiencing that object is applied in this way.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: That object is called the object of observation.

original: de'i phyir skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yang yin la zhes smos pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yang yin la zhes smos pas /
translated: Therefore, since it says, “It is the reason why they arise,”

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen skyed par byed pa nyid yin par grub po //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen skyed par byed pa nyid yin par grub po //
translated: it is established that the objective condition generates.

original: de'i rnam pa can nyid ni phyogs 'di la rab tu grags pa'i phyir ma bshad do //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can nyid ni phyogs 'di la rab tu grags pa'i phyir ma bshad do //
translated: Since the aspect of that is well known in this system, it is not explained.

original: de bas na gnyis ka'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i don gang yin pa de dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gnyis ka'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i don gang yin pa de dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object that possesses the characteristics of both is the objective condition.

original: de la 'di snyam du 'dus pa yang skyed par byed pa yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du 'dus pa yang skyed par byed pa yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that the collection also generates,

original: de'i phyir 'dus pa ni de lta yang ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus pa ni de lta yang ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then for that reason, it is said that the collection is not like that.

original: 'dus pa ni skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus pa ni skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The collection does not generate.

original: de rnam par rig pa mi skyed na ji ltar dmigs pa yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de rnam par rig pa mi skyed na ji ltar dmigs pa yin par 'gyur /
translated: If it does not generate consciousness, how can it be the objective condition?

original: ci ste skyed par byed pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste skyed par byed pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask, “Why does it not generate?”

original: rdzas su med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rdzas su med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said, “Because it does not substantially exist.”

original: gang gi phyir 'dus pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dus pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the collection does not substantially exist, it does not generate.

original: rdzas su med pa rnams la ni 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa med do //
analyzed: rdzas su med pa rnams la ni 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa med do //
translated: Those that do not substantially exist do not have the ability to generate results.

original: 'dus pa rdzas su med pa nyid ni 'og nas sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: 'dus pa rdzas su med pa nyid ni 'og nas sgrub par byed do //
translated: The fact that the collection does not substantially exist will be established later.

original: gang rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de ni skyed par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la dpe zla gnyis bzhin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de ni skyed par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la dpe zla gnyis bzhin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The example of the two moons is stated in the verse, “That which does not exist substantially does not cause the generation of anything.”

original: 'di ltar rdzas su med pa'i phyir zla ba gnyis pa ni zla ba gnyis par snang ba'i shes pa'i rgyu'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdzas su med pa'i phyir zla ba gnyis pa ni zla ba gnyis par snang ba'i shes pa'i rgyu'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because it does not exist substantially, the second moon cannot be the cause of the cognition that appears as two moons.

original: de bzhin du 'dus pa yang rang snang ba'i shes pa'i rgyu'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dus pa yang rang snang ba'i shes pa'i rgyu'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the collection cannot be the cause of the cognition that appears as itself.

original: gal te zla ba gnyis pas de mi skyed na /
analyzed: gal te zla ba gnyis pas de mi skyed na /
translated: If the second moon does not cause the generation of that cognition,

original: 'o na ni de'i rgyu mtshan med pa can du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni de'i rgyu mtshan med pa can du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then it would be without a cause.

original: de'i phyir dbang po ma tshang pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po ma tshang pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, “because the sense faculty is impaired.”

original: rgyu mtshan med pa can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med pa can ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not without a cause.

original: 'di ltar dbang po nyams pas zla ba gnyis su mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang po nyams pas zla ba gnyis su mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the impairment of the sense faculty prevents the perception of two moons.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe mig gi dbang po rab rib kyis nyams par 'gyur pa de'i tshe zla ba gnyis su snang ba'i shes pa skye par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe mig gi dbang po rab rib kyis nyams par 'gyur pa de'i tshe zla ba gnyis su snang ba'i shes pa skye par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, when the eye faculty is impaired by cataracts, a cognition of a double moon arises.

original: de zla ba gnyis pas skyed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de zla ba gnyis pas skyed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not produced by a double moon.

original: gang gi tshe de des ma skyed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de des ma skyed pa de'i tshe /
translated: When it is not produced by that,

original: zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa zla ba gnyis par snang du zin kyang /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa zla ba gnyis par snang du zin kyang /
translated: even though the cognition of a double moon appears as a double moon,

original: de'i yul ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i yul ni ma yin no //
translated: it is not its object.

original: de bas na skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir yul du mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir yul du mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is not a producer, it is not an object.

original: 'dir ma tshang ba zhes bya ba'i @179b spras ni nyams pa brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir ma tshang ba zhes bya ba'i @179b spras ni nyams pa brjod do //
translated: Here, the word “impaired” is used to express “incomplete.”

original: de ltar dpe la rab tu bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar dpe la rab tu bsgrubs nas /
translated: Having thus established the example,

original: dngos po la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to apply it to the actual case,

original: de bzhin du rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “In the same way, that which does not exist substantially . . .”

original: ji ltar zla ba gnyis pa rdzas su med pa'i phyir shes pa'i rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar zla ba gnyis pa rdzas su med pa'i phyir shes pa'i rgyu ma yin la /
translated: Just as a double moon is not a cause of cognition because it does not exist substantially,

original: rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir de'i yul ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dus pa yang rdzas su med pa'i phyir shes pa'i rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir de'i yul ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dus pa yang rdzas su med pa'i phyir shes pa'i rgyu ma yin la /
translated: Because it is not a cause, it is not the object of consciousness.

original: rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir de'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir de'i yul ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, the collection is not a cause of consciousness because it does not exist substantially.

original: 'dir sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba ni /
translated: The syllogism is:

original: 'dus pa ni rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dus pa ni rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The collection is not a cause of consciousness

original: rdzas su med pa'i phyir zla ba gnyis pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rdzas su med pa'i phyir zla ba gnyis pa bzhin no //
translated: because it does not exist substantially, like a second moon.

original: chos mi mthun pa ni rnam par shes pa'o /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa ni rnam par shes pa'o /
translated: Consciousness is the dissimilar example.

original: rdzas su med pa rnams la nus pa med pa ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: rdzas su med pa rnams la nus pa med pa ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
translated: The evidence that the non-substantial cannot have efficacy is the valid cognition that contradicts it.

original: yang na 'dus pa ni dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'dus pa ni dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Or, the syllogism is: The collection is not the object of consciousness

original: rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir zla ba gnyis pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir zla ba gnyis pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is not a cause, like a second moon.

original: chos mi mthun pa ni gzung ba'i cha ste /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa ni gzung ba'i cha ste /
translated: The part that is the object of apprehension is the dissimilar example.

original: gzung ba'i cha rgyu nyid yin pa dang / dmigs pa nyid yin par ni sgrub par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: gzung ba'i cha rgyu nyid yin pa dang / dmigs pa nyid yin par ni sgrub par 'gyur ro ;
translated: The evidence that the part that is the object of apprehension is a cause and is the object of consciousness is established.

original: / rgyu ma yin pa yang dmigs pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: / rgyu ma yin pa yang dmigs pa nyid yin na /
translated: If something that is not a cause can be an object of consciousness,

original: zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa yang dmigs pa nyid yin par 'gyur bas ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa yang dmigs pa nyid yin par 'gyur bas ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
translated: It follows, absurdly, that the second month and so on would also be the object of the mind, for they are also the object of the mind.

original: tshad ma 'di gnyis kyang slob dpon chos skyong gis bshad pa yin no //🔽de ltar phyogs gnyis ka bkag nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshad ma 'di gnyis kyang slob dpon chos skyong gis bshad pa yin no // de ltar phyogs gnyis ka bkag nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: These two valid cognitions are explained by the master Dharmottara.🔽Having thus refuted both positions, in order to draw a conclusion he says:

original: de ltar phyi rol gnyi gar yang //
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol gnyi gar yang //
translated: Thus, in both cases,

original: blo yi yul du mi rung ngo //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: blo yi yul du mi rung ngo // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: external objects are not the objects of the mind.

original: de ltar bshad pa'i tshul gyis na gnyi ga ltar na yang phyi rol gyi don rnam par shes pa'i yul du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa'i tshul gyis na gnyi ga ltar na yang phyi rol gyi don rnam par shes pa'i yul du mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, in both cases, external objects are not the objects of consciousness.

original: phyi rol ni rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol ni rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: External objects are not included in consciousness.

original: gnyi gar zhes bya ba la ni rdul phra rab kyi phyogs dang / 'dus pa'i phyogs ltar ro //
analyzed: gnyi gar zhes bya ba la ni rdul phra rab kyi phyogs dang / 'dus pa'i phyogs ltar ro //
translated: In both cases means either in the case of the partless particle or in the case of the composite.

original: blo'i zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i'o //
analyzed: blo'i zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i'o //
translated: The mind refers to consciousness.

original: ci'i phyir mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi rung zhe na /
translated: Why are they not the objects of the mind?

original: de'i phyir yan lag gcig ma tshang pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yan lag gcig ma tshang pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “because one part is missing,” and so on.

original: 'di ltar rdul phra rab kyi phyogs la ni rgyu nyid yod kyi de'i rnam pa nyid med do ;
analyzed: 'di ltar rdul phra rab kyi phyogs la ni rgyu nyid yod kyi de'i rnam pa nyid med do ;
translated: Thus, in the case of a partless particle, there is only a cause, but not its aspect.

original: /'dus pa'i phyogs la yang de'i rnam pa nyid yod kyi rgyu nyid med do //
analyzed: /'dus pa'i phyogs la yang de'i rnam pa nyid yod kyi rgyu nyid med do //
translated: In the case of an aggregate, there is only its aspect, but not a cause.

original: de lta bas na yan lag re re ma tshang ba'i phyir rdul phra rab ces bya ba dang / 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i don dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na yan lag re re ma tshang ba'i phyir rdul phra rab ces bya ba dang / 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i don dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because one part is missing, the meaning of “partless particle” and “aggregate” is not an object.

original: 'di skad du dmigs pa nyid kyi yan lag gi rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di skad du dmigs pa nyid kyi yan lag gi rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This is saying that an object has two aspects:

original: rang gi rnam pa 'jog @180a * //
analyzed: rang gi rnam pa 'jog @180a * //
translated: the establishment of its own aspect

original: pa dang / rgyu nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: pa dang / rgyu nyid yin pa'o //
translated: and its causal nature.

original: 'di yang rdul phra rab dang / 'dus pa dag la med pas /
analyzed: 'di yang rdul phra rab dang / 'dus pa dag la med pas /
translated: Since these are not present in partless particles and aggregates,

original: de gnyis yul nyid ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis yul nyid ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: those two are not objects.

original: gang las yul ni chos nyid gnyis dang ldan pa'o zhes 'byung ba der yang yan lag de gnyis kho na chos nyid gnyis kyi sgrar brjod par zad do //
analyzed: gang las yul ni chos nyid gnyis dang ldan pa'o zhes 'byung ba der yang yan lag de gnyis kho na chos nyid gnyis kyi sgrar brjod par zad do //
translated: In the passage, “The object is endowed with two natures,” those two members are simply called “two natures.”

original: de ltar phyogs gnyis ka bkag nas phyogs gsum pa nye bar dgod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar phyogs gnyis ka bkag nas phyogs gsum pa nye bar dgod pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus refuted both positions, in order to set forth a third position,

original: 'di la ni kha cig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di la ni kha cig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “In this regard, some say…”

original: phyi rol gyi don du smra bas phyogs 'di la yang pha khol la sogs pa kha cig rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i rnam pa dag dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyur 'dod do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du smra bas phyogs 'di la yang pha khol la sogs pa kha cig rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i rnam pa dag dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyur 'dod do //
translated: In this position, some, such as the Vātsīputrīyas, assert that the aspect of the aggregation of subtle atoms is the cause of the sense consciousness.

original: de dag 'di skad ces rdul phra rab rnams la ni 'dus pa'i rnam pa yang yod do //
analyzed: de dag 'di skad ces rdul phra rab rnams la ni 'dus pa'i rnam pa yang yod do //
translated: They say, “The subtle atoms have the aspect of aggregation.

original: rdul phra rab rnams la gang cung zad ci yod pa de thams cad ni /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams la gang cung zad ci yod pa de thams cad ni /
translated: Whatever exists in the subtle atoms, all of that

original: rdzas su yod pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa yin no //
translated: exists substantially.

original: rdzas su yod ba'i phyir 'dus pa'i rnam pa de rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzas su yod ba'i phyir 'dus pa'i rnam pa de rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it exists substantially, that aspect of aggregation becomes the cause of consciousness.”

original: rags pa'i phyir na rnam par shes pa la rang gi ngo bo yang 'jog par 'gyur ta /
analyzed: rags pa'i phyir na rnam par shes pa la rang gi ngo bo yang 'jog par 'gyur ta /
translated: And because of its grossness, consciousness would also be posited as having a nature.

original: de bas na rdul phra rab rnams tshul gzhan gyi yul nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bas na rdul phra rab rnams tshul gzhan gyi yul nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the atoms are the objects of another mode.

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni yang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni yang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The word “also” should be understood as having the sense of “even.”

original: 'dus pa'i rnam pa ni 'dir rags pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa'i rnam pa ni 'dir rags pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The mode of the collection is the gross mode here.

original: bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
translated: “Proof” means cause.

original: rdul phra rab rnams kyi rnam pa ni rab tu phra bar grags pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams kyi rnam pa ni rab tu phra bar grags pa ma yin nam /
translated: Aren’t the modes of the atoms well known to be subtle?

original: de bas na 'di dag la 'dus pa'i rnam pa 'di lta ga la yod srid pa yod du chug na yang gcig la rnam pa gnyis ji ltar rung zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na 'di dag la 'dus pa'i rnam pa 'di lta ga la yod srid pa yod du chug na yang gcig la rnam pa gnyis ji ltar rung zhe na /
translated: How then could there be this mode of the collection in them? Even if it were possible, how could there be two modes in one?

original: don thams cad ni rnam pa du ma can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don thams cad ni rnam pa du ma can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To this he says, “All objects have many modes, etc.”

original: 'di ni 'dir nyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir nyes pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not a fault here,

original: gang gi phyir dngos po gzugs can thams cad ni rnam pa du ma can yin bas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po gzugs can thams cad ni rnam pa du ma can yin bas so //
translated: because all material things have many modes.

original: 'di ltar gzugs can thams cad ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs can thams cad ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: In this way, all that has form has the nature of the four great elements.

original: de dag kyang sngon po dang dri zhim pa dang / mngar ba dang / rtsub pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pas rnam pa du ma can yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang sngon po dang dri zhim pa dang / mngar ba dang / rtsub pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pas rnam pa du ma can yin no //
translated: And since they have the aspects of blue, fragrant, sweet, rough, etc., they have many aspects.

original: yang ji ltar rdul phra rab rnams la rnam pa du ma dang ldan pa 'di yod ba de bzhin du 'dus pa'i rnam pa 'di yang de dag la yod bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang ji ltar rdul phra rab rnams la rnam pa du ma dang ldan pa 'di yod ba de bzhin du 'dus pa'i rnam pa 'di yang de dag la yod bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the subtle particles have many aspects, so too the aspects of the composite exist in them.

original: gal te don thams cad rnam pa du ma can yin na /
analyzed: gal te don thams cad rnam pa du ma can yin na /
translated: If all objects have many aspects,

original: @180b ci'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du mi shes she na /
analyzed: @180b ci'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du mi shes she na /
translated: why are they not known in all aspects?

original: de'i phyir de la rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “In that case, by some aspect, etc.”

original: 'di dag rnam pa du ma can yin mod kyi 'on kyang rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis 'di dag mngon sum nyid du 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'di dag rnam pa du ma can yin mod kyi 'on kyang rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis 'di dag mngon sum nyid du 'dod kyi /
translated: Even though they have many aspects, they are still asserted to be direct perception by some aspect.

original: rnam pa thams cad du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du ni ma yin te /
translated: But not by all aspects.

original: 'di ltar de dag gi nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir dbang po rnams ni don thams cad 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gi nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir dbang po rnams ni don thams cad 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, because their capacities are individually determined, the faculties do not apprehend all objects.

original: 'di ni btsun pa sangs rgyas lha'i gzhung lugs kyi rjes su 'brangs nas bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni btsun pa sangs rgyas lha'i gzhung lugs kyi rjes su 'brangs nas bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is explained following the scriptural tradition of the Venerable Buddhadeva.

original: de ltar na skye mched bcu ni 'byung ba tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de ltar na skye mched bcu ni 'byung ba tsam du zad do //
translated: Thus, the ten bases are merely the elements.

original: de ltar rnam pa du ma can nyid du bsgrubs nas rna la ma dang sbyar ba'i phyir rdul phra rab rnams la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa du ma can nyid du bsgrubs nas rna la ma dang sbyar ba'i phyir rdul phra rab rnams la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Having thus established their manifold nature, in order to apply it to the atoms, he says, “Even in atoms, etc.”

original: rdul phra rab rnams la yang 'dus par snang ba'i shes pa bskyed pa'i rgyu'i dngos po yod de /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams la yang 'dus par snang ba'i shes pa bskyed pa'i rgyu'i dngos po yod de /
translated: Even in atoms, there is the state of being a cause for the production of the cognition that appears as an aggregation,

original: rdul phra rab rnams kyi 'dus pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa skyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams kyi 'dus pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa skyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: meaning that a cognition having the aspect of the aggregation of atoms is produced.

original: rdul phra rab rnams la 'dus pa'i rnam pa yod pa sgrub par byed pas rdul phra rab rnams la 'dus pa'i rnam pa yod do zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams la 'dus pa'i rnam pa yod pa sgrub par byed pas rdul phra rab rnams la 'dus pa'i rnam pa yod do zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: But since you prove that subtle particles have the aspect of aggregation, shouldn’t you say that subtle particles have the aspect of aggregation?

original: ce'i phyir 'di skad du rdul phra rab rnams la yang 'dus par snang ba'i shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu yod do zhes smras she na /
analyzed: ce'i phyir 'di skad du rdul phra rab rnams la yang 'dus par snang ba'i shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu yod do zhes smras she na /
translated: Why do you say that subtle particles have a cause that generates a consciousness appearing as an aggregation?

original: 'dir smras ba /
analyzed: 'dir smras ba /
translated: Here we say:

original: dmigs pa'i cha gnyis rab tu bstan pa'i phyir de skad ces smras te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i cha gnyis rab tu bstan pa'i phyir de skad ces smras te /
translated: That is said in order to demonstrate the two parts of the object.

original: de la shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu'i dngos po zhes bya ba smras pas ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu'i dngos po zhes bya ba smras pas ni /
translated: In that regard, by saying “the entity that is the cause that generates consciousness,”

original: rgyu nyid yin par rang gi sgras bstan to //
analyzed: rgyu nyid yin par rang gi sgras bstan to //
translated: the word “cause” itself is indicated.

original: 'dus par snang ba zhes smras pas ni rnam pa 'jog pa dang 'dus pa'i rnam pa yod pa nyid kyang bsgrubs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dus par snang ba zhes smras pas ni rnam pa 'jog pa dang 'dus pa'i rnam pa yod pa nyid kyang bsgrubs pa yin te /
translated: By saying “appearing as an aggregation,” the establishment of the aspect and the existence of the aspect of aggregation are also established.

original: gang gi phyir don gyis ni rnam par shes pa la rang gi bdag nyid la yod pa'i rnam pa 'jog gi med pa ni ma yin pa de'i phyir 'dus pa'i rnam pa yod par yang smras pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don gyis ni rnam par shes pa la rang gi bdag nyid la yod pa'i rnam pa 'jog gi med pa ni ma yin pa de'i phyir 'dus pa'i rnam pa yod par yang smras pa kho na yin no //
translated: Because the object does present an aspect to consciousness, and that aspect exists in the object itself, not in the consciousness, therefore, it is said that the aspect of the collection exists.

original: gal te rdul phra rab rnams la rags pa'i rnam pa yod na go //
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab rnams la rags pa'i rnam pa yod na go //
translated: If the gross aspect exists in the atoms,

original: ji ltar de dag la rdul phra rab ces bya /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag la rdul phra rab ces bya /
translated: how can they be called atoms?

original: ji ltar phra mo'i rnam pa de nye bzhin du yang mi 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar phra mo'i rnam pa de nye bzhin du yang mi 'dzin zhe na /
translated: How is it that one does not apprehend that subtle aspect?

original: de'i phyir rdul phran rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdul phran rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “The atom is the subtle aspect, etc.”

original: de nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir ji ltar sra ba nyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir ji ltar sra ba nyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to explain that very point, he says, “Just as solidity, etc.”

original: ji ltar sra ba nyid dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba la @181a * //
analyzed: ji ltar sra ba nyid dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba la @181a * //
translated: Just as solidity, fluidity, heat,

original: sogs pa'i yul rnams yod bzhin du yang /
analyzed: sogs pa'i yul rnams yod bzhin du yang /
translated: and motility exist as objects,🔽but are not apprehended as such,

original: dbang po'i nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir mig gi blo'i yul nyid du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du rdul phra mo yang de bzhin du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir mig gi blo'i yul nyid du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du rdul phra mo yang de bzhin du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the capacity of the sense faculties is determined individually, the object of visual cognition is not the object of auditory cognition, and so on. In the same way, the subtle particle is not the object of visual cognition.

original: rnam pa de nyid la brten nas kyang 'di dag la rdul phra rab ces tha snyad gdags so //
analyzed: rnam pa de nyid la brten nas kyang 'di dag la rdul phra rab ces tha snyad gdags so //
translated: Based on that very aspect, they are designated as subtle particles.

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nyid ces bya ba'i don du blta bar bya'o //
