analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nyid ces bya ba'i don du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The word “only” should be understood to mean “just.”

original: de ltar phyogs gsum pa nye bar bkod nas sun dbyung ba de dag ltar na bum pa dang / kham phor la sogs blo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar phyogs gsum pa nye bar bkod nas sun dbyung ba de dag ltar na bum pa dang / kham phor la sogs blo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Having thus presented the third position and refuted it, he says, “The cognition of a pot, a plate, and so on,” and so forth.

original: gang dag rdul rab rnams la 'dus pa'i rnam pa yod par khas len pa de dag la brgal zhing brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: gang dag rdul rab rnams la 'dus pa'i rnam pa yod par khas len pa de dag la brgal zhing brtag par bya ste /
translated: Those who accept that the subtle particles have the aspect of aggregation should be questioned and examined as follows.

original: rdul phra rab rnams la 'dus pa'i rnam pa gang zhig khas len /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams la 'dus pa'i rnam pa gang zhig khas len /
translated: What is the aspect of aggregation that is accepted in the subtle particles?

original: re zhig 'jig rten na ni bum pa dang / kham phor dang / phor bu la sogs pa dang / ka ba dang dri la sogs pa la 'dus par grags so //
analyzed: re zhig 'jig rten na ni bum pa dang / kham phor dang / phor bu la sogs pa dang / ka ba dang dri la sogs pa la 'dus par grags so //
translated: In the world, a pot, a saucer, a cup, a pillar, a wall, etc., are known as composites.

original: 'di dag gi nang na rnam pa gang zhig rdul phra rab rnams la yod par 'dod /
analyzed: 'di dag gi nang na rnam pa gang zhig rdul phra rab rnams la yod par 'dod /
translated: What aspect of these is accepted as existing in the atoms?

original: gal te bum pa'i rnam pa'i zhe na de'i tshe kham phor la sogs pa 'dus pa thams cad la bum pa'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bum pa'i rnam pa'i zhe na de'i tshe kham phor la sogs pa 'dus pa thams cad la bum pa'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the aspect of the pot, then the idea of a pot will occur in regard to all composites, a saucer, etc.

original: 'on te kham phor gyi rnam pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te kham phor gyi rnam pa'o zhe na /
translated: If it is the aspect of the saucer,

original: de'i tshe yang thams cad la kham phor gyi blo 'byung bar 'gyur gyi kha cig la ni bum pa'i blo kha cig la ni kham phor gyi blo zhes bya ba blo tha dad pa dag yin pa 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang thams cad la kham phor gyi blo 'byung bar 'gyur gyi kha cig la ni bum pa'i blo kha cig la ni kham phor gyi blo zhes bya ba blo tha dad pa dag yin pa 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then the idea of a saucer will occur in regard to all composites, and the idea of a pot will not occur in regard to some of them.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: blo ni yul la rang gi ngo bo'i rjes su byed cing skye la /
analyzed: blo ni yul la rang gi ngo bo'i rjes su byed cing skye la /
translated: The idea conforms to the object and arises.

original: yul yang ngo bo gcig pa yin na de ji ltar blo tha dad par 'gyur zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: yul yang ngo bo gcig pa yin na de ji ltar blo tha dad par 'gyur zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: If the object is also of a single nature, how could the cognition be different?

original: de la 'di snyam du /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du /
translated: If you think

original: bum pa la ni rdul phra rab mang la /
analyzed: bum pa la ni rdul phra rab mang la /
translated: that a pot has many subtle particles,

original: kham phor la ni ches nyung ste /
analyzed: kham phor la ni ches nyung ste /
translated: but a saucer has fewer,

original: de bzhin du ni gzhan dag la yang mang ba dang nyung ba nyid rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni gzhan dag la yang mang ba dang nyung ba nyid rig par bya'o //
translated: and that in the same way, others are known to have more or fewer,

original: de'i phyir mang ba dang nyung ba nyid kyis byas pa'i blo'i khyad par 'di yod do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de'i phyir mang ba dang nyung ba nyid kyis byas pa'i blo'i khyad par 'di yod do snyam du sems na /
translated: and therefore this difference in cognition is due to the difference in the number of particles,🔽then Nāgārjuna explains:🔽The difference in the number of subtle particles

original: de'i phyir bum pa dang kham phor la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bum pa dang kham phor la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: in a pot and a saucer, and so on,

original: 'di la ni /
analyzed: 'di la ni /
translated: is not tenable.

original: nyung du dang mang po nyid kyis byas pa'i blo'i khyad par mi rung ste /
analyzed: nyung du dang mang po nyid kyis byas pa'i blo'i khyad par mi rung ste /
translated: The difference in the number of subtle particles in a pot and a saucer, and so on, is not tenable.🔽Why is that?

original: 'di ltar bum pa la rdul phra rab mang la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa la rdul phra rab mang la /
translated: Because a pot has many subtle particles,

original: kham phor la ches nyung mod kyi /
analyzed: kham phor la ches nyung mod kyi /
translated: but a saucer has fewer.

original: 'on kyang rdul phra rab tu gtogs pa 'dus pa'i @181b rnam pa la rang la yod pa'i khyad par ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang rdul phra rab tu gtogs pa 'dus pa'i @181b rnam pa la rang la yod pa'i khyad par ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: But the aspect of the aggregation of atoms does not have any difference from the individual atoms.

original: de'i phyir nyes pa de'i so na 'dug ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyes pa de'i so na 'dug ste /
translated: Therefore, the fault remains.

original: gang du rdul phra rab mang ba der ni bum pa che la /
analyzed: gang du rdul phra rab mang ba der ni bum pa che la /
translated: In whatever place there are many atoms, there is a large pot.🔽In whatever place there are fewer, there is a small pot.

original: gang du ches nyung ba der ni bum pa chung ngo zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig tu 'gyur bar zad kyi 'dus pa'i rnam pa 'dra ba las mang po las ni bum pa'i blo /
analyzed: gang du ches nyung ba der ni bum pa chung ngo zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig tu 'gyur bar zad kyi 'dus pa'i rnam pa 'dra ba las mang po las ni bum pa'i blo /
translated: This is all that can be said. But the cognition of a pot does not arise from the aspect of the aggregation of many atoms,

original: nyung ngu la ni kham phor gyi blo 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'dir ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyung ngu la ni kham phor gyi blo 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'dir ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and the cognition of a saucer does not arise from the aspect of the aggregation of fewer atoms.

original: 'dir gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the opportunity for the opponent's words here,

original: gal te rnam pa'i dbye bas dbye zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gal te rnam pa'i dbye bas dbye zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, If it is said that it is distinguished by the distinction of aspects.

original: de nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to fully explain that,

original: gal te 'di snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, If you think... and so on.

original: gal te 'di snyam du bum pa'i mgrin pa ni gyen du blta la /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du bum pa'i mgrin pa ni gyen du blta la /
translated: If you think that the neck of the pot faces upward,

original: de yang zhum pa yin /
analyzed: de yang zhum pa yin /
translated: Moreover, it is depressed.

original: lto ni rked na 'dug la de yang yangs pa yin te /
analyzed: lto ni rked na 'dug la de yang yangs pa yin te /
translated: The belly is in the middle and it is wide.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa ni 'di'i rnam pa'i dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa ni 'di'i rnam pa'i dbye ba yin no //
translated: Such are the divisions of its aspects.

original: kham phor ni kha ni yangs la /
analyzed: kham phor ni kha ni yangs la /
translated: The mouth of the pot is wide,🔽and the bottom is depressed.

original: zhabs ni zhum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa'i dbye ba yin te /
analyzed: zhabs ni zhum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa'i dbye ba yin te /
translated: Such are the divisions of its aspects.🔽Therefore, the cognitions of pot, bowl, etc.🔽are different in terms of their aspects.🔽If you think this,

original: de'i phyir rnam pa'i dbye ba'i sgo nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa'i dbye ba'i sgo nas /
translated: due to the difference in aspects,🔽the cognitions of pot, bowl, etc.

original: bum pa dang kham phor la sogs pa'i blo rnams tha dad par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na'o //
analyzed: bum pa dang kham phor la sogs pa'i blo rnams tha dad par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na'o //
translated: would be different in terms of their aspects.

original: rnam pa'i khyad par las zhes bya ba la rnam pa zhes bya ba ni dbyibs te /
analyzed: rnam pa'i khyad par las zhes bya ba la rnam pa zhes bya ba ni dbyibs te /
translated: The word “aspect” means shape,

original: bkod pa dang / gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bkod pa dang / gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: which means arrangement and location.

original: rnam pa'i dbye ba yul ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa'i dbye ba yul ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the difference in aspects is not the object,

original: khyad par 'di ni bum pa la sogs pa la yod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khyad par 'di ni bum pa la sogs pa la yod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “This difference exists in the pot, etc.”

original: khyod kyi bum pa dang gzhan kham phor la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par bstan pa gang yin pa de dag gi khyad par 'di ni yod de /
analyzed: khyod kyi bum pa dang gzhan kham phor la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par bstan pa gang yin pa de dag gi khyad par 'di ni yod de /
translated: The difference that you have taught between your pot and other things such as a dish, that difference exists.

original: de ni kho bo cag kyang mi bsnyon mod kyi /
analyzed: de ni kho bo cag kyang mi bsnyon mod kyi /
translated: We do not deny that.

original: 'on kyang rdul phra rab rdzas su yod pa gang dag yin pa de dag la ni rnam pa'i dbye ba de med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang rdul phra rab rdzas su yod pa gang dag yin pa de dag la ni rnam pa'i dbye ba de med do //
translated: However, those subtle particles that exist as substances do not have that difference of aspect.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshad dbye med phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tshad dbye med phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “because there is no difference in size.”

original: 'di ltar rdul phra rab rnams kyi tshad zlum po zhes bya ba gang yin pa de la ni dbye ba med do //🔽bum pa'i rdul phra rab rnams kyang rdzas gzhan kho na yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rdul phra rab rnams kyi tshad zlum po zhes bya ba gang yin pa de la ni dbye ba med do // bum pa'i rdul phra rab rnams kyang rdzas gzhan kho na yin la /
translated: Thus, that which is called the size of the subtle particles is not differentiated.🔽The subtle particles of a pot are a different substance,

original: kham phor gyi yang rdzas gzhan ma yin nam /
analyzed: kham phor gyi yang rdzas gzhan ma yin nam /
translated: and the subtle particles of a dish are also a different substance, are they not?

original: de ji ltar tshad dbye ba med ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar tshad dbye ba med ce na /
translated: How can there be no difference in size?

original: de'i phyir du rdul phra rab rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir du rdul phra rab rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “The subtle particles are not different in size,” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir bum pa dang / kham phor la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams rdzas gzhan nyid yin du zin kyang zlum po la tha dad pa med @182a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bum pa dang / kham phor la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams rdzas gzhan nyid yin du zin kyang zlum po la tha dad pa med @182a * //
translated: Because, even though the subtle particles of a pot, a bowl, etc. are different substances, there is no difference in their roundness.

original: pa de'i phyir rdul phra rab rnams la rnam pa'i dgye ba med do //
analyzed: pa de'i phyir rdul phra rab rnams la rnam pa'i dgye ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no difference in the shape of the subtle particles.

original: ji ltar khyed kyi ltar na rdul phra rab rnams las ji dang / ji snyed pa yod pa de thams cad rdzas su yod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar khyed kyi ltar na rdul phra rab rnams las ji dang / ji snyed pa yod pa de thams cad rdzas su yod pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as, according to you, everything that exists in terms of the subtle particles and the quantity of the subtle particles exists substantially,

original: rdul phra rab rnams la tshad cung zad ci yod pa de thams cad kyang zlum po'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams la tshad cung zad ci yod pa de thams cad kyang zlum po'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: so too, whatever size the subtle particles have, all of that is the nature of roundness.

original: rdul phra rab rnams kyi zlum po yang ngo bo nyid gcig pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams kyi zlum po yang ngo bo nyid gcig pa kho na yin no //
translated: And the roundness of the subtle particles is of one nature alone.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar de dag gi dbye bas tha dad par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar de dag gi dbye bas tha dad par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could there be a difference due to their division?

original: 'dus pa'i rnam pa rags par 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dus pa'i rnam pa rags par 'dod mod kyi /
translated: Although the form of the composite is asserted to be gross,

original: 'on kyang rdzas su yod pa'i phyir de yang cha shas med pa nyid du 'gyur dgos so //
analyzed: 'on kyang rdzas su yod pa'i phyir de yang cha shas med pa nyid du 'gyur dgos so //
translated: nevertheless, because it exists substantially, it too must be partless.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it were not so,

original: 'di cha shas dang bcas pa yin na rdzas su yod pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di cha shas dang bcas pa yin na rdzas su yod pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it has parts, it will not be substantially existent.

original: cha shas med pa'i phyir de la bkod pa tha dad pa lta ga la yod de /
analyzed: cha shas med pa'i phyir de la bkod pa tha dad pa lta ga la yod de /
translated: How can it have a different arrangement, since it is partless?

original: gang dag cha shas dang bcas pa de dag ni nus pa sna tshogs pas bkod par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang dag cha shas dang bcas pa de dag ni nus pa sna tshogs pas bkod par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Those that have parts have different arrangements due to their various capacities,

original: cha shas med pa dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: cha shas med pa dag ni ma yin no //
translated: but not those that are partless.

original: de ltar rdul phra rab rnams kyi rnam pa'i dbye ba bkag nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /🔽de'i phyir de rdzas med la yod //
analyzed: de ltar rdul phra rab rnams kyi rnam pa'i dbye ba bkag nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir / de'i phyir de rdzas med la yod //
translated: Having thus refuted the classification of atoms, in order to summarize,

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, “Therefore, it exists without being substantial.”

original: gang gi phyir de ltar bshad pa'i rnam pas cha shas med pa rnams la bkod pa tha dad pa mi srid pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar bshad pa'i rnam pas cha shas med pa rnams la bkod pa tha dad pa mi srid pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since those that are partless cannot possibly have a different arrangement, as has been explained,

original: de ni rdzas su med pa rnams kho na la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rdzas su med pa rnams kho na la blta bar bya'o //
translated: it should be seen that it exists without being substantial.

original: bstan bcos byed pas mdo'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas mdo'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the meaning of the sūtra, the author of the treatise says,🔽“The classification of the aggregates, elements, and bases is for the sake of countering the belief in a real self and what belongs to it.”

original: rnam pa'i dbye ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽rnam pa'i dbye ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rnam pa'i dbye ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽rnam pa'i dbye ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The classification of the aggregates, elements, and bases is for the sake of countering the belief in a real self and what belongs to it.

original: kun rdzob tu yod pa dag kho na la yod de /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod pa dag kho na la yod de /
translated: Only those that exist conventionally exist.

original: cha shas dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha shas dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have parts.

original: rdul phra rab rnams la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams la ni ma yin te /
translated: But not the subtle particles,

original: cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have no parts.

original: bye brag pa'i ltar na bum pa la sogs pa rdzas su yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: bye brag pa'i ltar na bum pa la sogs pa rdzas su yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: According to the Vaiseikas, such things as pots exist substantially.

original: de'i phyir brgya zhig la de bum pa la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yod pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes zhes smra bar gyur na /
analyzed: de'i phyir brgya zhig la de bum pa la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yod pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes zhes smra bar gyur na /
translated: Therefore, they say, how can we know that such things as pots exist conventionally?

original: de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa ni kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa ni kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Such things as pots exist conventionally.”

original: bum pa la sogs pa ni kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba de ltar shes par bya ste /🔽'di ltar rdul phra rab re re nas yongs su brtsal bar byas na yang bum pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa mi skye'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ni kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba de ltar shes par bya ste / 'di ltar rdul phra rab re re nas yongs su brtsal bar byas na yang bum pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa mi skye'o //
translated: Such things as pots should be known to exist conventionally.

original: der snang shes pa nyams 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: der snang shes pa nyams 'gyur phyir //
translated: Because if one searches for a pot in terms of each of its subtle particles, the cognition of the form of a pot does not arise.🔽Because the cognition of the form of a pot does not arise when one searches for a pot in terms of each of its subtle particles, such things as pots exist conventionally.

original: zhes bya ba ni shes pa 'di la de lta bur snang ba yod pas na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shes pa 'di la de lta bur snang ba yod pas na /
translated: This is because this consciousness appears in that way.

original: 'di ni @182b der snang ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni @182b der snang ba ste /
translated: This is the appearance as that.

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bum pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bum pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The term “that” is connected with the pot.

original: snang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'dra bar brjod do //
analyzed: snang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'dra bar brjod do //
translated: The term “appearance” is used to express similarity.

original: de ni der snang ba yang yin la /
analyzed: de ni der snang ba yang yin la /
translated: That is the appearance as that.

original: shes pa yang yin pas na /🔽der snang shes pa'o //🔽de nyams pa ni der snang shes pa nyams pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa yang yin pas na / der snang shes pa'o // de nyams pa ni der snang shes pa nyams pa ste /
translated: And it is consciousness.🔽Therefore, it is the appearance as that consciousness.🔽The impairment of that is the impairment of the appearance as that consciousness.

original: der snang shes pa nyams pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der snang shes pa nyams pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the impairment of the appearance as that consciousness,

original: rdul phra rab re re nas yongs su bsal na bum pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa mi skyed zin kyang /
analyzed: rdul phra rab re re nas yongs su bsal na bum pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa mi skyed zin kyang /
translated: when each atom is removed, the consciousness that has the aspect of a pot and so on is not produced.

original: ci de tsam gyi bum pa la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid du 'gyur ram zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / rdzas su yod pa rnams la ni //
analyzed: ci de tsam gyi bum pa la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid du 'gyur ram zhe na / de'i phyir / rdzas su yod pa rnams la ni //
translated: But is a pot and so on that is merely that substantially existent?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “Those that are substantially existent,” and so on.

original: 'di ltar gang dag rdzas su yod pa de dag ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang dag rdzas su yod pa de dag ni /
translated: Thus, those that are substantially existent🔽are not impaired when their parts are removed.

original: 'brel ba can bsal kyang rang gi blo yongs su mi 'dor te /
analyzed: 'brel ba can bsal kyang rang gi blo yongs su mi 'dor te /
translated: Even when the related are removed, the cognition of it is not relinquished.

original: dper na kha dog la sogs pa lta bu'o //🔽gal te bum pa la sogs pa yang rdzas su yod pa zhig yin par gyur na ni de'i tshe de dag kyang rang dang 'brel ba can yongs su bsal kyang /
analyzed: dper na kha dog la sogs pa lta bu'o // gal te bum pa la sogs pa yang rdzas su yod pa zhig yin par gyur na ni de'i tshe de dag kyang rang dang 'brel ba can yongs su bsal kyang /
translated: For example, it is like the cognition of color and so on.

original: rang gi blo mi 'dor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi blo mi 'dor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a pot and so on were to exist substantially, then at that time even they would not relinquish their own cognition even when the related are removed.

original: rdul phra rab re re nas yongs su bsal bar byas nas /🔽rdzas rtsom par byed pa'i sbyor ba zhig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rdul phra rab re re nas yongs su bsal bar byas nas / rdzas rtsom par byed pa'i sbyor ba zhig pa'i phyir /
translated: But since the cognition of a pot is relinquished when the pot is destroyed,

original: bum pa zhig pas de'i phyir bum pa'i blo mi skye ba yin nam /
analyzed: bum pa zhig pas de'i phyir bum pa'i blo mi skye ba yin nam /
translated: therefore the cognition of a pot does not arise.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhe na /🔽'dir bshad pa gal te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhe na / 'dir bshad pa gal te /
translated: But it is not because it does not exist in any way.

original: rdul phra rab las ma gtogs pa bum pa la sogs pa yan lag can gyi rdzas zhig yod na /
analyzed: rdul phra rab las ma gtogs pa bum pa la sogs pa yan lag can gyi rdzas zhig yod na /
translated: Here we say: If a whole substance such as a pot existed apart from the particles,🔽then the cognition of a pot would not be relinquished when the pot is destroyed.

original: de'i tshe rdul phra rab dag la yod do zhes brjod par bya ba ci de dag la ji snyed yod pa'i ngo bos yod dam /
analyzed: de'i tshe rdul phra rab dag la yod do zhes brjod par bya ba ci de dag la ji snyed yod pa'i ngo bos yod dam /
translated: Do they exist in the nature of whatever exists in them?

original: 'on te phyogs gcig gis yin /
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gcig gis yin /
translated: Or do they exist in part?

original: de la rtsom par byed pa'i cha shas ma gtogs pa gang dag gis ni de de la yod par 'gyur ba cha shas can gyi phyogs gcig gis yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la rtsom par byed pa'i cha shas ma gtogs pa gang dag gis ni de de la yod par 'gyur ba cha shas can gyi phyogs gcig gis yod pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not exist in part, in the nature of the whole, except for the part that is the beginning of composition.

original: gal te phyogs gcig gis yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phyogs gcig gis yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If they do not exist in part,

original: de'i tshe ji snyed yod pa'i ngo bos yod do zhes bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: de'i tshe ji snyed yod pa'i ngo bos yod do zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: then they exist in the nature of whatever exists in them.

original: de'i phyir rdul phra rab dag ji snyed pa de snyed kyi bum pa la sogs pa'i cha shas can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rdul phra rab dag ji snyed pa de snyed kyi bum pa la sogs pa'i cha shas can du 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, as many subtle particles as there are, there are that many parts of the whole, such as a vase.

original: des na cha shas can gyi gcig pa nyams par 'gyur ro //🔽'dir sbyor ba ni cha shas ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na cha shas can gyi gcig pa nyams par 'gyur ro // 'dir sbyor ba ni cha shas ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus the oneness of the whole is undermined.

original: dus gcig tu dngos po du ma nye bar len pa'i phyir /🔽rta ma yin pa nyid la sogs @183a * //
analyzed: dus gcig tu dngos po du ma nye bar len pa'i phyir / rta ma yin pa nyid la sogs @183a * //
translated: Here the syllogism is: The part does not substantially exist because it simultaneously appropriates many things,

original: pa bzhin no //
analyzed: pa bzhin no //
translated: like non-horseness and so on.

original: chos mi mthun pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The dissimilar property is the intrinsic identity.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni bshad pa'i rnam pas dus gcig tu dngos po du ma nye bar len pa nyid du mi 'thad pa ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni bshad pa'i rnam pas dus gcig tu dngos po du ma nye bar len pa nyid du mi 'thad pa ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
translated: If it were the intrinsic reality of things, then it would be untenable for many things to be appropriated simultaneously in the manner explained. This is the valid cognition that contradicts that.

original: de ltar na phyogs gsum char la yang /
analyzed: de ltar na phyogs gsum char la yang /
translated: Thus, in all three positions,

original: phyi rol gyi don dmigs pa nyid du mi 'thad do zhes bsgrubs nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don dmigs pa nyid du mi 'thad do zhes bsgrubs nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: having established that the perception of external objects is untenable, he concludes:

original: de lta bas na dbang po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na dbang po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, the cognition of the senses and so on.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rdul phra rab rnams dmigs par mi rung ba de'i phyir dbang po'i blo rnams kyi phyi rol gyi don gyi yul can ma yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rdul phra rab rnams dmigs par mi rung ba de'i phyir dbang po'i blo rnams kyi phyi rol gyi don gyi yul can ma yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Because in that way the atoms are not suitable to be perceived, therefore the cognition of the senses does not have external objects as its object. This is established.

original: de ltar gzhan gyi gzhung lugs bkag nas rnam pa thams cad du dmigs pa bkag nas /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyi gzhung lugs bkag nas rnam pa thams cad du dmigs pa bkag nas /
translated: Having refuted the opponent’s position in that way, having refuted perception in every way,

original: khas blangs pa la grags pas gnod par 'gyur du 'ongs pas rang gi gzhung lugs la dmigs pa rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khas blangs pa la grags pas gnod par 'gyur du 'ongs pas rang gi gzhung lugs la dmigs pa rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it would follow that the opponent’s position would be undermined by what is commonly acknowledged, in order to demonstrate the presentation of the objects of one’s own textual system, the root text says:🔽

original: shes bya nang gi ngo bo ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes bya nang gi ngo bo ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach the presentation of the object of one’s own textual system, because it would come to be that the opponent’s position would be undermined by what is renowned, he says, “The object of knowledge is the internal nature . . .”

original: mdo'i don ni shes pa la /
analyzed: mdo'i don ni shes pa la /
translated: The meaning of the sūtra is that consciousness is the object of knowledge.

original: shes bya'i rnam pa beg bur chad pa lta bur snang ba gang yin pa de kho na shes pa'i yul yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: shes bya'i rnam pa beg bur chad pa lta bur snang ba gang yin pa de kho na shes pa'i yul yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The aspect of the object of knowledge appears suddenly, like a reflection, and that is the object of consciousness.

original: nang zhes bya ba ni nang ste /
analyzed: nang zhes bya ba ni nang ste /
translated: “ Internal” means internal.

original: de yang 'dir shes pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'dir shes pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: And here, it should be viewed as consciousness.

original: nang zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni rang bzhin gyis bdun pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: nang zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni rang bzhin gyis bdun pa'i don yin te /
translated: This term “internal” has the sense of “inherent.”

original: des na shes pa la nang zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na shes pa la nang zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, consciousness is explained as “internal.”

original: shes bya'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni yul gyi rnam pa gzung ba'i cha zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes bya'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni yul gyi rnam pa gzung ba'i cha zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “ The nature of the object of knowledge” means the apprehended aspect of the object. This is what is meant by the term “aspect of the object.”

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgras ni nges par gzung ba dang / bar du chod pa'i don du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgras ni nges par gzung ba dang / bar du chod pa'i don du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The word “only” should be understood as having the sense of “exclusively” and “alone.”

original: phyi rol ltar snang zhes bya ba ni phyi rol lta bur mngon pa ste /
analyzed: phyi rol ltar snang zhes bya ba ni phyi rol lta bur mngon pa ste /
translated: “ Appearing as external” means appearing as if external.

original: rnam par chad pa lta bur zhes bya bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par chad pa lta bur zhes bya bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “ As if divided” means as if separate.

original: de de ltar snang ba'i rgyu mtshan yang nam mkha'i khams snang ba yin no //🔽nam mkha' de ni rnam par shes pa la snang bas na /🔽rnam par shes pa las beg bur chad pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de de ltar snang ba'i rgyu mtshan yang nam mkha'i khams snang ba yin no // nam mkha' de ni rnam par shes pa la snang bas na / rnam par shes pa las beg bur chad pa bzhin du /
translated: The cause of its appearance in that way is the appearance of the element of space.🔽That space appears in consciousness as if it were separate from consciousness.

original: des gzung ba'i char ston par byed de /
analyzed: des gzung ba'i char ston par byed de /
translated: It appears as if it were a part of the object that is grasped by consciousness.

original: dper na zla ba'i gzugs brnyan me long gi ngos su 'byung ba na /
analyzed: dper na zla ba'i gzugs brnyan me long gi ngos su 'byung ba na /
translated: For example, when the reflection of the moon appears in a pool of water,

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi gzugs brnyan gyi dbang gis khron pa na 'dug pa ltar beg bur chad par snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi gzugs brnyan gyi dbang gis khron pa na 'dug pa ltar beg bur chad par snang ba bzhin no //
translated: the reflection of the element of space appears as if it were in a well.

original: phyi rol gyi yul med na rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyan nyid 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul med na rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyan nyid 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If external objects do not exist, then would not the condition of the object of consciousness be nonexistent?

original: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don zhes bya ba la sogs @183b pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don zhes bya ba la sogs @183b pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “The so-called external object . . . ”

original: 'di la dmigs pa'i rkyen med pa'i nyes pa med de /
analyzed: 'di la dmigs pa'i rkyen med pa'i nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault in saying that the object condition does not exist.

original: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi don med mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi don med mod kyi /
translated: Although external objects do not exist,

original: 'on kyang nang na phyi rol lta bur snang ba yod pa kho na bas /
analyzed: 'on kyang nang na phyi rol lta bur snang ba yod pa kho na bas /
translated: nevertheless, there is an internal object that appears as if it were external.

original: de ni dmigs pa'i rkyen ru 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa'i rkyen ru 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it becomes the object condition.

original: dper na rab rib can gyis skra shad dang / sha sprang la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi blo la /
analyzed: dper na rab rib can gyis skra shad dang / sha sprang la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi blo la /
translated: For example, in the case of a person with an eye disease, the cognition that has the form of a hair, a double moon, and so on,

original: skra shad la sogs pa'i rnam pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa'i rnam pa lta bu'o //
translated: is like the form of a hair, and so on.

original: 'di skad du gzung ba'i cha de ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du rung ba'i phyir dmigs pa'i rkyen nyid du bshad do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du gzung ba'i cha de ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du rung ba'i phyir dmigs pa'i rkyen nyid du bshad do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said: Because the aspect of the object of apprehension is suitable as the characteristic of the object, it is explained as the object condition.

original: yang 'di ji ltar dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du rung zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'di ji ltar dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du rung zhe na /
translated: How is it suitable as the characteristic of the object?

original: de'i phyir rnam shes ngo bo'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽gang gi phyir shes pa sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa spros po bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan par skye ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam shes ngo bo'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gang gi phyir shes pa sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa spros po bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan par skye ba de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, “because of the nature of consciousness.”🔽Because consciousness arises in the aspect of blue, yellow, etc., due to the maturation of the latent impressions of conceptual thought, it is established as having the aspect of blue, yellow, etc.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can yin pas de'i rnam pa can nyid du grub la gang gi phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa de rnam par shes pa de'i rkyen yin pa de'i phyir rgyu nyid du yang grub po //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can yin pas de'i rnam pa can nyid du grub la gang gi phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa de rnam par shes pa de'i rkyen yin pa de'i phyir rgyu nyid du yang grub po //
translated: Because the aspect of blue, etc., is the condition of that consciousness, it is also established as the cause.

original: de'i rkyen ni de'i rkyen nyid de /
analyzed: de'i rkyen ni de'i rkyen nyid de /
translated: The condition of that is the condition of that.

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam par shes pa dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam par shes pa dang sbyor ro //
translated: The word “that” is connected with consciousness.

original: de'i ngo bo ni de'i rkyen nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni de'i rkyen nyid do //
translated: The nature of that is the condition of that.

original: de'i rkyen nyid yin pa de'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rkyen nyid yin pa de'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is the condition of that,

original: gsum pa 'di ni gtan tshigs la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsum pa 'di ni gtan tshigs la blta bar bya'o //
translated: this third reason should be seen as the reason.

original: bstan bcos byed pas mdo'i don rnam par dgrol ba'i thabs kyi mjug bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir nang gi rnam par shes pa ni don du snang ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas mdo'i don rnam par dgrol ba'i thabs kyi mjug bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir nang gi rnam par shes pa ni don du snang ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to conclude the method of explaining the meaning of the sūtras by composing a treatise, he says, “The internal consciousness appears as an object,” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa ni nang na yod pa'i don gyi rnam pas de'i rnam pa can dang / don gyi rnam pa de yod na de skyes pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa ni nang na yod pa'i don gyi rnam pas de'i rnam pa can dang / don gyi rnam pa de yod na de skyes pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because consciousness exists as an aspect of an internal object, it has that aspect, and when that aspect of the object exists, it arises. For that reason,

original: chos nyid gnyis dang ldan pas na nang gi nyid dmigs pa yin par rigs so //
analyzed: chos nyid gnyis dang ldan pas na nang gi nyid dmigs pa yin par rigs so //
translated: because it possesses the two natures, it is logical that the internal itself is the object.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: This is what is said:

original: rnam par shes pa ni nang na yod pa'i don gyi rnam par bris pa'i rnam pa lta bur snang ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni nang na yod pa'i don gyi rnam par bris pa'i rnam pa lta bur snang ngo //
translated: Consciousness appears as if it were a drawing of an internal object.

original: de lta bas na de'i rnam pa can yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i rnam pa can yin te /
translated: Therefore it has that aspect.

original: dper na rgya bris pa'i rnam pas de'i rnam pa can yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rgya bris pa'i rnam pas de'i rnam pa can yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like a drawing of a seal having the aspect of that.

original: gang gi phyir gzung ba'i cha yod na skyes pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzung ba'i cha yod na skyes pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because it arises when the aspect of the object exists,

original: rnam par shes pa de ni de las skyes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de ni de las skyes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: That consciousness is also called arisen from that.

original: de bas na dmigs pa'i cha gnyis ka yod pas 'di ni dmigs pa nyid du rigs so zhes bshad pa yan @184a * //
analyzed: de bas na dmigs pa'i cha gnyis ka yod pas 'di ni dmigs pa nyid du rigs so zhes bshad pa yan @184a * //
translated: Therefore, since both parts of the object exist, it is logical that this is the object.

original: no ; /'dir gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: no ; /'dir gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the opportunity for others’ words here, he says:

original: re zhig de ltar snang ba nyid yin la ni rag na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa rnam par shes pa la nang na yod pa'i shes bya snang ba nyid ni yin la rag ste /
analyzed: re zhig de ltar snang ba nyid yin la ni rag na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa rnam par shes pa la nang na yod pa'i shes bya snang ba nyid ni yin la rag ste /
translated: If consciousness is the appearance of the object of knowledge existing internally,

original: 'di ltar de ni shes bya'i rnam pa nges bris pa'i rnam pa lta bur skye'o zhes bshad na de'i phyogs gcig tu gyur ba dang / lhan cig skyes pa shes bya'i rnam pa gang yin pa de go ji ltar rnam par shes pa de'i rkyen du 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni shes bya'i rnam pa nges bris pa'i rnam pa lta bur skye'o zhes bshad na de'i phyogs gcig tu gyur ba dang / lhan cig skyes pa shes bya'i rnam pa gang yin pa de go ji ltar rnam par shes pa de'i rkyen du 'gyur /
translated: then how could the aspect of the object of knowledge that is simultaneous and one part of that consciousness be a condition of that consciousness?

original: de lta yin na ni bdag nyid la byed par khas blangs pa dang / ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni bdag nyid la byed par khas blangs pa dang / ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that were the case, it would be accepted that it acts on itself, and there would be the fault of overextension.

original: 'dzin pa'i cha yang gzung ba'i cha skyed par byed par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i cha yang gzung ba'i cha skyed par byed par 'gyur la /
translated: And the aspect of apprehending would generate the aspect of the apprehended.

original: ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon kyang phan tshun skyod par byed pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'o //
analyzed: ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon kyang phan tshun skyod par byed pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'o //
translated: And wouldn’t it follow absurdly that the right and left horns of an ox would generate each other?

original: 'di la bstan bcos byed pas lan gdab par /
analyzed: 'di la bstan bcos byed pas lan gdab par /
translated: To this, the author of the treatise replies:

original: gcig cha'ang mi 'khrul phyir na rkyen //
analyzed: gcig cha'ang mi 'khrul phyir na rkyen //
translated: Even though they are simultaneous, they are conditions because they are not confused.

original: zhes bya ba smos so //🔽de nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so // de nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir //
translated: To explain this, he says:

original: lhan cig par gyur du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: lhan cig par gyur du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Even though they are simultaneous, etc.

original: 'di ni 'dir nyes par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir nyes par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Here, there is no fault,

original: gang gi phyir gzung ba'i cha ni lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur du zin kyang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzung ba'i cha ni lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur du zin kyang /
translated: because even though the aspect of the apprehended is simultaneous,

original: rkyen gzhan rgyu dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang / bdag po dag las skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen nyid du 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: rkyen gzhan rgyu dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang / bdag po dag las skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen nyid du 'gyur bas so //
translated: it becomes the objective condition of consciousness, which arises from other conditions, such as the immediately preceding condition and the dominant condition.

original: 'di ltar gzung ba'i cha de med par rnam par shes pa de mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzung ba'i cha de med par rnam par shes pa de mi 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, consciousness does not occur without that objective aspect.

original: de ni dbyug pa la brten pa'i tshul du dmigs par bya ba 'ga' zhig tu zad kyi /🔽'di rkyen ril gyi bya ba byed pa'am /
analyzed: de ni dbyug pa la brten pa'i tshul du dmigs par bya ba 'ga' zhig tu zad kyi / 'di rkyen ril gyi bya ba byed pa'am /
translated: It is merely an object of perception, like a stick.🔽It is not the case that the function of all conditions is to produce it,

original: rkyen re re la sgro gdags pa ni ma yin no //🔽gal te yang shes pa de gzung ba'i cha de las phan 'dogs pa mi re na ci ste /
analyzed: rkyen re re la sgro gdags pa ni ma yin no // gal te yang shes pa de gzung ba'i cha de las phan 'dogs pa mi re na ci ste /
translated: or that it is a superimposition on each individual condition.

original: de med par yang mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: de med par yang mi 'byung ste /
translated: Moreover, if that consciousness does not require the assistance of that objective aspect, why does it not occur without that objective aspect?🔽Thus, it is not the case that it does not occur without that objective aspect.

original: 'di ltar phan tshun mi 'dogs pa la ltos par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar phan tshun mi 'dogs pa la ltos par mi 'gyur la /
translated: For, that which does not assist would not be dependent on the other,

original: phan mi 'dogs pa ni med du zin kyang 'ga' yang mi 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽gal te rnam pa 'dis gzung ba'i cha yang rgyu nyid du 'gyur du zad de /
analyzed: phan mi 'dogs pa ni med du zin kyang 'ga' yang mi 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro // gal te rnam pa 'dis gzung ba'i cha yang rgyu nyid du 'gyur du zad de /
translated: and that which does not assist would not be nonexistent.

original: 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: If that objective aspect is not a cause of consciousness, what is the contradiction?

original: ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon dag ni 'khrul ba'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med do //
analyzed: ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon dag ni 'khrul ba'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med do //
translated: The right and left horns of an ox are not related as cause and effect because they are confused.

original: bdag nyid la byed pa yang la lar 'dod pa nyid de /
analyzed: bdag nyid la byed pa yang la lar 'dod pa nyid de /
translated: Sometimes it is asserted that it is the self that is the object of the view of the self.🔽

original: dper na mar @184b me lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mar @184b me lta bu'o //
translated: Sometimes, the agent is also the object, as in the case of the flame.

original: de ni bdag nyid kha nas bdag nyid gsal bar byed do //🔽cha'i bye brag gis ni bdag nyid la byed pa yang yod re skan /
analyzed: de ni bdag nyid kha nas bdag nyid gsal bar byed do // cha'i bye brag gis ni bdag nyid la byed pa yang yod re skan /
translated: The flame illuminates itself.🔽But the agent is not the object in the case of the seed, etc.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan can yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan can yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is it that the relation of cause and effect is not confused?

original: 'di ltar gtan tshigs pa dag ni yod pa dang med pa dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gtan tshigs pa dag ni yod pa dang med pa dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The logicians say that the existence and non-existence of things is due to the existence and non-existence of their causes.🔽The logicians say that the existence and non-existence of things is due to the existence and non-existence of their causes.

original: 'di ltar gtan tshigs pa dag ni yod pa dang med pa dag gi yod pa dang med pa nyid gang yin pa de ni rgyu dang rgyu dang ldan pa'i rim gyis skye ba dag gi yang mtshan nyid yin par smra ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gtan tshigs pa dag ni yod pa dang med pa dag gi yod pa dang med pa nyid gang yin pa de ni rgyu dang rgyu dang ldan pa'i rim gyis skye ba dag gi yang mtshan nyid yin par smra ste /
translated: The existence and non-existence of things is due to the existence and non-existence of their causes.

original: gang zhig yod na gang yod la //
analyzed: gang zhig yod na gang yod la //
translated: When this exists, that comes to be;🔽from the arising of this, that arises.

original: de med na med pa de ni rgyu yin la /🔽cig shos ni rgyu dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de med na med pa de ni rgyu yin la /🔽cig shos ni rgyu dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: When this does not exist, that does not come to be;🔽from the cessation of this, that ceases.

original: 'di la yang gzung ba'i cha yod na shes pa yod la med na med de /
analyzed: 'di la yang gzung ba'i cha yod na shes pa yod la med na med de /
translated: If there is an objective part in this, consciousness exists; if not, it does not exist.

original: de lta bas na lhan cig 'byung ba de gnyis kyang rgyu dang rgyu dang ldan pa nyid du 'grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na lhan cig 'byung ba de gnyis kyang rgyu dang rgyu dang ldan pa nyid du 'grub po //
translated: Thus, even those two that occur together are established as cause and effect.

original: gtan tshigs pa dag ces bya ba ni gang dag gtan tshigs kyi tha snyad 'dogs pa de dag ni gtan tshigs pa dag ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs pa dag ces bya ba ni gang dag gtan tshigs kyi tha snyad 'dogs pa de dag ni gtan tshigs pa dag ste /
translated: The logicians are those who make the convention of a logical reason.

original: rtog ge ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtog ge ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: the sophists.

original: de dang ldan pa nyid ces bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa pa dang ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa nyid ces bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa pa dang ldan pa nyid do //
translated: The state of being endowed with that is the state of being endowed with existence and non-existence.

original: rgyu dang rgyu dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ces bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: rgyu dang rgyu dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ces bya ba'i don te //
translated: The state of being endowed with cause and effect is the meaning of cause and effect.

original: de ltar re zhig yul dang yul can gyi dngos po dus mnyam pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig yul dang yul can gyi dngos po dus mnyam pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, the state of object and subject is taught as simultaneous.

original: da ni rim gyis yul dang yul can gyi dngos po bstan pa'i phyir /🔽yang na / nus pa 'jog phyir rim gyis yin //
analyzed: da ni rim gyis yul dang yul can gyi dngos po bstan pa'i phyir / yang na / nus pa 'jog phyir rim gyis yin //
translated: Now, in order to teach the state of object and subject in sequence,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says:🔽In order to posit potentiality, it is sequential.

original: yang na gzung ba'i cha de nus pa 'jog pa na rim gyis skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo'i yul du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na gzung ba'i cha de nus pa 'jog pa na rim gyis skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo'i yul du 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, when the aspect of the object is deposited as a potentiality, it becomes the object in the nature of the cause that generates it gradually.

original: 'di ltar gzung ba'i cha de 'gag pa na //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzung ba'i cha de 'gag pa na //
translated: Thus, when the aspect of the object ceases,

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la nus pa 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la nus pa 'jog par byed do //
translated: it deposits a potentiality in the store consciousness.

original: nus pa de gal te skad cig ma gnyis pa la lhan cig byed pa rnams sgrub na ni de'i tshe skad cig ma gnyis pa kho na la rang dang mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed do //
analyzed: nus pa de gal te skad cig ma gnyis pa la lhan cig byed pa rnams sgrub na ni de'i tshe skad cig ma gnyis pa kho na la rang dang mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed do //
translated: If that potentiality is actualized in the second moment by the assemblage of causes, then at that time, in the second moment, it generates a consciousness that is similar to itself.

original: gal te mi sgrub na ni de'i tshe skad cig ma gsum pa'am /🔽bzhi ba la yang rung gang gi tshe 'di sgrub par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te mi sgrub na ni de'i tshe skad cig ma gsum pa'am / bzhi ba la yang rung gang gi tshe 'di sgrub par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: If it is not actualized, then at the time of the third or fourth moment,🔽when it is actualized,

original: yongs su smin nas rang dang mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su smin nas rang dang mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: it ripens and generates a consciousness that is similar to itself.

original: phyogs 'di la ni bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir dang / phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir dang / lhan cig skyes pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya @185a * //
analyzed: phyogs 'di la ni bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir dang / phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir dang / lhan cig skyes pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya @185a * //
translated: In this context, it is contradictory for something to act on itself, because it is a single part, and because it is co-present.🔽

original: ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa mi srid de /🔽'di ltar shes pa snga ma la gzung ba'i cha sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa yod pa gang yin pa de /
analyzed: ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa mi srid de / 'di ltar shes pa snga ma la gzung ba'i cha sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa yod pa gang yin pa de /
translated: In this context, the errors of the self being contradictory with itself, being a part, and being coemergent are not possible.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa phyi ma skyed par byed do //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa phyi ma skyed par byed do //
translated: Thus, the aspect of the object of prior cognition that exists as the aspect of blue and so on generates the subsequent cognition that possesses the aspect of blue and so on.

original: de'i phyir nyes pa 'di rnams lta srid re skan /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyes pa 'di rnams lta srid re skan /
translated: Therefore, how could these errors be possible?

original: gal te nus pas shes pa skyed na /
analyzed: gal te nus pas shes pa skyed na /
translated: If you assert that consciousness is generated by potential,

original: de lta na 'o na ni nus pa kho na yul du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni nus pa kho na yul du 'gyur gyi /
translated: then in that case, potential alone would be the object,

original: gzung ba'i cha snga ma ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gzung ba'i cha snga ma ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: but the prior aspect of the object would not.

original: rim gyis kyang yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rim gyis kyang yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you think that, then the response is that it is also sequential.

original: 'di nyid nyes pa med do /
analyzed: 'di nyid nyes pa med do /
translated: This is not an error.

original: 'di ltar rim gyis kyang gzung ba'i cha de ni rang dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rten can gyi nus pa byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rim gyis kyang gzung ba'i cha de ni rang dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rten can gyi nus pa byed do //
translated: In this way, even in the case of gradual [cognition], the aspect of the object of cognition functions as the potential of the ālaya consciousness that produces a result that is concordant with itself.

original: gal te gzung ba'i cha des nus pa de gzhag par ma gyur na ni nus pa des shes pa de lta bu skyed par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gzung ba'i cha des nus pa de gzhag par ma gyur na ni nus pa des shes pa de lta bu skyed par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that aspect of the object of cognition did not deposit that potential, then that potential would not produce a cognition like that.

original: de'i phyir nus pa las skye ba'i shes pa de yang gzung ba'i cha de kho na las skyes pa yin pas 'gal ba 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir nus pa las skye ba'i shes pa de yang gzung ba'i cha de kho na las skyes pa yin pas 'gal ba 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Therefore, since that cognition that arises from potential is also produced from that very aspect of the object of cognition, there is no contradiction at all.

original: phyogs 'di la ni chos nyid gnyis dang ldan pa shin tu yang 'thad de /
analyzed: phyogs 'di la ni chos nyid gnyis dang ldan pa shin tu yang 'thad de /
translated: In this position, the two realities are very tenable.

original: 'di ltar gzung ba'i cha des rang dang mthun pa'i shes pa phyi ma de skyed pas de'i phyir chos nyid gnyis dang ldan pa yod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzung ba'i cha des rang dang mthun pa'i shes pa phyi ma de skyed pas de'i phyir chos nyid gnyis dang ldan pa yod do //
translated: In this way, since that aspect of the object of cognition produces the subsequent cognition that is concordant with itself, therefore the two realities exist.

original: 'dir gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate an opportunity for the words of others,🔽he says, “If the aspect of the object of cognition is not the object of cognition, how can it be the cause of the cognition?”

original: gal te 'o na nang gi gzugs kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽gal te khyod nang gi gzugs kho na dmigs pa'i rkyen yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na nang gi gzugs kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gal te khyod nang gi gzugs kho na dmigs pa'i rkyen yin par 'dod na /
translated: If you say that internal form alone is the objective condition of eye consciousness, then it would not be the objective condition of eye consciousness that sees the color of fire, since that is external.🔽

original: de'i tshe ji ltar nang gi gzugs de dang mig la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar nang gi gzugs de dang mig la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ste /
translated: If you say that the internal form itself is the condition of observation, then how does the eye consciousness arise in dependence on the internal form and the eye?

original: 'di ltar mig sngar snang bar gyur ba'i gzugs gang yin pa de dang lhan cig pa'i mig gis rang gi rnam par shes pa skyed na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig sngar snang bar gyur ba'i gzugs gang yin pa de dang lhan cig pa'i mig gis rang gi rnam par shes pa skyed na /
translated: In this way, the eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and the form that appears before it.

original: nang gi gzugs ni mig sngar snang bar yang mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: nang gi gzugs ni mig sngar snang bar yang mi 'gyur na /
translated: But internal form does not appear before the eye.

original: de ji ltar nang gi gzugs de dang lhan cig pa'i mig gis mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed ces brjod par bya /
analyzed: de ji ltar nang gi gzugs de dang lhan cig pa'i mig gis mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed ces brjod par bya /
translated: So how can you say that the eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and the internal form?

original: de ni nam yang mdun na mi 'dug na /
analyzed: de ni nam yang mdun na mi 'dug na /
translated: Since it never appears before the eye,

original: de ji ltar snang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'o //
analyzed: de ji ltar snang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'o //
translated: how can it appear?

original: bstan bcos byed pas 'di'i lan gdab par /🔽lhan cig byed dbang nus pa yi //
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas 'di'i lan gdab par /🔽lhan cig byed dbang nus pa yi //
translated: The author of the treatise responds to this objection:🔽The eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and the form that appears before it.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says this and so forth.

original: gal te dbang po 'byung ba las gyur pa yin na ni de'i tshe nyes pa 'dir 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po 'byung ba las gyur pa yin na ni de'i tshe nyes pa 'dir 'gyur na /
translated: If the sense faculty were derived from the elements, then this error would ensue.

original: kho bo @185b can ni dbang nyid du 'dod pa'i dngos po yul lhan cig byed pa'i nus pa gang yin pa de dbang po yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: kho bo @185b can ni dbang nyid du 'dod pa'i dngos po yul lhan cig byed pa'i nus pa gang yin pa de dbang po yin par 'dod de /
translated: But we assert that the sense faculty is the capacity of the object that is the cause of the sense faculty.

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag gi ltar na ji ltar gzugs nang gi yin pa de bzhin du mig kyang nang gi kho na yin pas ji skad smras pa'i nyes par lta zhig ga la yod /
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag gi ltar na ji ltar gzugs nang gi yin pa de bzhin du mig kyang nang gi kho na yin pas ji skad smras pa'i nyes par lta zhig ga la yod /
translated: Therefore, just as form is internal, so too the eye is internal. How could there be the error that you have stated?

original: lhan cig byed dbang zhes bya ba 'di ni yul dang lhan cig byed pa'i dbang por 'dod pa'i zhes bya bar de ltar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhan cig byed dbang zhes bya ba 'di ni yul dang lhan cig byed pa'i dbang por 'dod pa'i zhes bya bar de ltar blta bar bya'o //
translated: This so-called capacity of the object that is the cause of the sense faculty should be viewed as the sense faculty that is the cause of the object.

original: de lta ma yin gyi dbang po'i dbang po zhes byas nas ni 'brel ba med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta ma yin gyi dbang po'i dbang po zhes byas nas ni 'brel ba med par 'gyur la /
translated: If it were not so, then the term sense faculty of the sense faculty would be meaningless.

original: dbang po'i dbang po zhes brjod na mdzes par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i dbang po zhes brjod na mdzes par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And it would not be elegant to say sense faculty of the sense faculty.

original: yang dbang po nus pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes she na /🔽de'i phyir / dbang po ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang dbang po nus pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes she na / de'i phyir / dbang po ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Again, how do we know that the nature of the sense faculties is potential?🔽To explain, he says, “The sense faculties are inferred to be the nature of potential from their result, the consciousness.”

original: gang gi phyir dbang po ni rang gi 'bras bu rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid las nus pa'i ngo bo nyid du rjes su dpag gi /'byung ba las gyur pa nyid du ni ma yin pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po ni rang gi 'bras bu rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid las nus pa'i ngo bo nyid du rjes su dpag gi /'byung ba las gyur pa nyid du ni ma yin pas so //
translated: Because the sense faculties are inferred to be the nature of potential from their result, the consciousness characterized as a sense consciousness, but not from being derived from the elements.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu las ni rgyu tsam rjes su dpag par nus kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu las ni rgyu tsam rjes su dpag par nus kyi /
translated: In this way, from a result, it is possible to infer just the cause,

original: rgyu'i khyad par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par ni ma yin te /
translated: but not the specific cause.

original: khyad par gyi rtags la khyab pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par gyi rtags la khyab pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is impossible for a sign of a specific cause to pervade the result.

original: ji ltar du ba las me tsam rjes su dpag par nus kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar du ba las me tsam rjes su dpag par nus kyi /
translated: For example, it is possible to infer just fire from smoke,

original: me'i khyad par rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: me'i khyad par rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: but not the specific cause of fire, such as grass or leaves.

original: 'bras bu'i rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid las rgyu tsam rjes su dpag par nus kyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid las rgyu tsam rjes su dpag par nus kyi /
translated: In the same way, from the result, the consciousness characterized as a sense consciousness, it is possible to infer just the cause,

original: rgyu'i khyad par 'byung ba las gyur ba nyid la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par 'byung ba las gyur ba nyid la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a specific cause such as the elements.

original: 'di ltar bye brag tu smra ba'i ltar na ni dbang po 'byung ba las gyur pa yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar bye brag tu smra ba'i ltar na ni dbang po 'byung ba las gyur pa yin /
translated: For example, according to the Vaibhāṣikas, the sense faculty is derived from the elements.

original: btsun sangs rgyas lha'i ltar na ni 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid yid /
analyzed: btsun sangs rgyas lha'i ltar na ni 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid yid /
translated: According to Bhadanta Buddhadeva, it is the essence of the elements.

original: rnam 'byor spyod pa'i ltar na ni rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin /
analyzed: rnam 'byor spyod pa'i ltar na ni rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin /
translated: According to the Yogācāras, it is the essence of consciousness.

original: dbu ma ba'i ltar na ni kun rdzob tu yod pa yin /
analyzed: dbu ma ba'i ltar na ni kun rdzob tu yod pa yin /
translated: According to the Mādhyamikas, it exists conventionally.

original: grangs can pa'i ltar na ni nga'o snyam pa yin pas de lta bu la sogs pa'i khyad par rjes su dpag par mi nus so //🔽de lta bas na nus pa rgyu tsam du rjes su dpog par byed pas nus pa tsam rjes su dpog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grangs can pa'i ltar na ni nga'o snyam pa yin pas de lta bu la sogs pa'i khyad par rjes su dpag par mi nus so // de lta bas na nus pa rgyu tsam du rjes su dpog par byed pas nus pa tsam rjes su dpog par 'gyur ro //
translated: According to the Sāṃkhyas, it is the thought “I am.” Thus it is impossible to infer its specific attributes.🔽Therefore, since one infers mere potentiality as the mere cause, one infers mere potentiality.

original: de la 'di snyam du nus pa ni nus pa dang ldan pa la ltos te /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du nus pa ni nus pa dang ldan pa la ltos te /
translated: If you think that potentiality depends on the possessor of potentiality,

original: nus pa can gzhi med par ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: nus pa can gzhi med par ni mi rung ngo //
translated: it is not tenable that the possessor of potentiality is without a basis.

original: nus pa dang ldan pa ni dbang po yin la /
analyzed: nus pa dang ldan pa ni dbang po yin la /
translated: The possessor of potentiality is the sense faculty.

original: de yang 'byung ba las gyur ba yin pas dbang po 'byung ba las gyur ba yin par grub @186a * //
analyzed: de yang 'byung ba las gyur ba yin pas dbang po 'byung ba las gyur ba yin par grub @186a * //
translated: Since they are derived from the elements, it is established that the sense faculties are derived from the elements.

original: po snyam du sems na /
analyzed: po snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that the sense faculty is derived from the elements because it is a derivative of the elements,🔽then Nāgārjuna explains:

original: de'i phyir / de yang rnam rig la mi 'gal //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de yang rnam rig la mi 'gal // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: That is not contradictory for consciousness.

original: gal te rten zhig gdon mi za bar dgos na /
analyzed: gal te rten zhig gdon mi za bar dgos na /
translated: If a support is necessary,

original: rnam par shes pa de nyid rten yin du zad de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de nyid rten yin du zad de /
translated: it is sufficient that consciousness itself is the support.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa la ni yul so sor rnam par rig pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang / rang rig pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga la grags so //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa la ni yul so sor rnam par rig pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang / rang rig pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga la grags so //
translated: In this way, consciousness is renowned to both parties because it has the nature of the awareness of individual objects and the nature of reflexive awareness.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las kyis yongs su bsgos pa rten yin du zad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las kyis yongs su bsgos pa rten yin du zad de /
translated: Therefore it is sufficient that consciousness itself, which is fully infused by karma, is the support.

original: nus pa ni gang gis na de rnam par shes pa'i rten can du mi rung bar 'gyur pa rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'gal ba ni med do //
analyzed: nus pa ni gang gis na de rnam par shes pa'i rten can du mi rung bar 'gyur pa rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'gal ba ni med do //
translated: There is no contradiction with consciousness because there is no capacity that would make it unsuitable to be the support of consciousness.

original: de la 'di snyam du 'byung ba las gyur pa la rnam par gnas pa'i nus pa yang 'bras bu gzhan skyed la /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du 'byung ba las gyur pa la rnam par gnas pa'i nus pa yang 'bras bu gzhan skyed la /
translated: If you think that the potential that is present in the primary elements generates another effect,

original: rnam par shes pa la gnas pa yang gzhan skyed do /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la gnas pa yang gzhan skyed do /
translated: and the potential that is present in consciousness generates another effect,🔽then you should understand that the sense faculty is definitely derived from the primary elements.

original: de lta bas na dbang po ni gdon mi za bar 'byung ba las gyur pa kho na yin par shes par bya'o snyam du sems na de'i dogs pa bsu bar nus pa ni rnam par shes pa la yod kyang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so
analyzed: de lta bas na dbang po ni gdon mi za bar 'byung ba las gyur pa kho na yin par shes par bya'o snyam du sems na de'i dogs pa bsu bar nus pa ni rnam par shes pa la yod kyang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so
translated: To anticipate that qualm, the root text states, “The potential is present in consciousness, or it is present in something else.”

original: // 'di la ni rten gyis byas pa'i khyad par med de /
analyzed: // 'di la ni rten gyis byas pa'i khyad par med de /
translated: In this case, there is no difference in the sense faculty that is created by the primary elements.

original: 'di ltar nus pa ni gal te rnam par shes pa la rnam par gnas kyang rung /
analyzed: 'di ltar nus pa ni gal te rnam par shes pa la rnam par gnas kyang rung /
translated: Thus, if the potential is present in consciousness,

original: 'on te gzhan la rnam par gnas kyang rung /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan la rnam par gnas kyang rung /
translated: or if it is present in something else,

original: rnam pa thams cad du des ni gzugs mthong ba la sogs pa tsam zhig bya bar zad pas de'i phyir 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba la khyad par med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du des ni gzugs mthong ba la sogs pa tsam zhig bya bar zad pas de'i phyir 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba la khyad par med do //
translated: in every case, it merely causes the seeing of form and so on. Therefore, there is no difference in the effect that is generated.

original: bstan du med pa'i rang gi ngo bo la zhes bya ba ni gzhan 'dod pa'i dbang po'i rang gi ngo bo ni dbang pos mi sod pa'i phyir brtag par mi nus so //
analyzed: bstan du med pa'i rang gi ngo bo la zhes bya ba ni gzhan 'dod pa'i dbang po'i rang gi ngo bo ni dbang pos mi sod pa'i phyir brtag par mi nus so //
translated: “The nature of the sense faculty that is not manifest” means that the nature of the sense faculty as it is accepted by others cannot be imagined because it is not perceived by the sense faculty.

original: ma brtags pa yang bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: ma brtags pa yang bstan par mi nus te /
translated: And that which is not imagined cannot be taught.

original: de'i phyir gzhan 'dod pa'i dbang po ni bstan du med pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan 'dod pa'i dbang po ni bstan du med pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin no //
translated: Therefore, the sense faculty as it is accepted by others has a nature that is not manifest.

original: 'o na dbang po'i nus pa de'i rgyu gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dbang po'i nus pa de'i rgyu gang yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is the cause of the potentiality of the sense faculty?

original: mjug bsdu ba'i thabs kyis de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i thabs kyis de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that by way of a concluding summary, he says,

original: de ltar yul gyi ngo bo dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar yul gyi ngo bo dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “In this way, the nature of the object . . .”

original: ji ltar rnam par shes pa 'di dbang po'i nus pa las skye ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par shes pa 'di dbang po'i nus pa las skye ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as this consciousness arises from the potentiality of the sense faculty,

original: dbang po'i nus pa 'di la yang //🔽dbang po 'phen par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa yang snga ma las skye la /
analyzed: dbang po'i nus pa 'di la yang // dbang po 'phen par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa yang snga ma las skye la /
translated: in the same way, this potentiality of the sense faculty🔽arises from a prior potentiality of the sense faculty.

original: sngon gyi rnam par shes pa de yang dbang po'i nus pa yang snga ma las skye'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi rnam par shes pa de yang dbang po'i nus pa yang snga ma las skye'o //
translated: And that prior consciousness arises from a prior potentiality of the sense faculty.

original: de ltar @186b na 'di lta ste dbang po'i nus pa dang / yul gyi rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa 'di gnyis ni phan tshun gyi rgyu can du 'jug la /
analyzed: de ltar @186b na 'di lta ste dbang po'i nus pa dang / yul gyi rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa 'di gnyis ni phan tshun gyi rgyu can du 'jug la /
translated: Thus, the two—the potential of the sense faculty and the consciousness that has the aspect of the object—are mutually causal.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu brgyud pa 'di'i dus kyi thog ma yang med pas 'di gnyis thog ma med pa'i dus par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu brgyud pa 'di'i dus kyi thog ma yang med pas 'di gnyis thog ma med pa'i dus par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Since there is no beginning of this continuum of cause and effect, these two should be regarded as beginningless.

original: bstan bcos byed pas mdo'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas mdo'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the sūtra, the author of the treatise says:

original: mig ces bya ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mig ces bya ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The potential of the eye faculty,🔽and the consciousness that has the aspect of the object,🔽arise in dependence on the eye faculty and form.

original: mig ces bya ba'i dbang po'i nus par bstan pa gang yin pa dang / nang gi gzugs lhan cig skyes pa'am /
analyzed: mig ces bya ba'i dbang po'i nus par bstan pa gang yin pa dang / nang gi gzugs lhan cig skyes pa'am /
translated: The potential of the eye faculty is taught to be the cause of the eye consciousness.

original: sngar byung ba la brten nas ma nges pa'i don gyi rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes la skye'o //🔽ji ltar phyi rol gyi don du smra ba ltar na nges pa'i don kho na las rnam par shes pa skye ba ltar /
analyzed: sngar byung ba la brten nas ma nges pa'i don gyi rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes la skye'o //🔽ji ltar phyi rol gyi don du smra ba ltar na nges pa'i don kho na las rnam par shes pa skye ba ltar /
translated: The consciousness that has the aspect of the object arises in dependence on the eye faculty and form.🔽The eye faculty is the cause of the eye consciousness, and form is the cause of the aspect of the object.

original: 'di la ni de lta ma yin pas de'i phyir 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di la ni de lta ma yin pas de'i phyir 'di skad du /
translated: But this is not so in the case of consciousness, and therefore it is said that

original: rnam par shes pa don du snang ba dmigs kyis ma phye ba skye'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa don du snang ba dmigs kyis ma phye ba skye'o zhes bshad do //
translated: consciousness arises without distinguishing the appearance of the object.

original: gzhan dag ni brjod du med pa'i don du snang ba zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni brjod du med pa'i don du snang ba zhes zer te /
translated: Others say that it is the appearance of an inexpressible object.

original: de ni don shin tu 'brel par mi snang ste /
analyzed: de ni don shin tu 'brel par mi snang ste /
translated: But that does not appear as a very related object,

original: brjod du med pa nyid ni 'dir cung zad kyang mi dgos so //
analyzed: brjod du med pa nyid ni 'dir cung zad kyang mi dgos so //
translated: and it is not necessary to have anything at all that is inexpressible.

original: 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid thams cad ni brjod du med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid thams cad ni brjod du med pa ste /
translated: Thus, all specific characteristics are inexpressible.

original: gal te der snang ba'i shes pa skye ba yin na des na dngos su ci zhig 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te der snang ba'i shes pa skye ba yin na des na dngos su ci zhig 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: If consciousness arises as the appearance of that, then what is actually accomplished?

original: 'o na te don gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de brjod par mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na te don gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de brjod par mi nus so zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that the consciousness that arises in the aspect of the object is inexpressible,

original: de la yang ci med pa'i phyir brjod par mi nus sam /
analyzed: de la yang ci med pa'i phyir brjod par mi nus sam /
translated: then is it inexpressible because it does not exist at all?

original: 'on te rang gi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro zhig gal te med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rang gi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro zhig gal te med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Or is it inexpressible because of its specific characteristic? If it is because it does not exist at all,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not logical.

original: 'di ltar med pa'i ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang rjod par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar med pa'i ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang rjod par byed do //
translated: In the same way, one can speak of the horns of a rabbit, etc., which do not exist.

original: 'on te rang gi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rang gi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is because of its specific characteristic,
