original: 'di la ni lan btab zin to //🔽mig ces bya ba'i nus pa la brten nas zhes bya ba 'dir sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mngon par rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la ni lan btab zin to // mig ces bya ba'i nus pa la brten nas zhes bya ba 'dir sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mngon par rtogs par bya ste /
translated: we have already answered this.🔽The expression “and so on” in the phrase “based on the capacity called eye” should be understood as follows:

original: des ni mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba la zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba la zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The expression “and so on” indicates that the phrase “called eye” should be applied to the other sense faculties.

original: 'o na nus pa de gang las skye zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na nus pa de gang las skye zhe na /
translated: If this is so, then what is the origin of this capacity?

original: 'di gnyis kyang phan tshun gyi rgyu can dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyang phan tshun gyi rgyu can dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says, “These two are mutually causal.”

original: nus pa de yang dbang po 'phen par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa snga ma las skye zhing /🔽rnam par shes pa de yang nus pa yang snga ma las skye la /🔽nus pa de yang dbang po 'phen par byed @187a * //
analyzed: nus pa de yang dbang po 'phen par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa snga ma las skye zhing / rnam par shes pa de yang nus pa yang snga ma las skye la / nus pa de yang dbang po 'phen par byed @187a * //
translated: This capacity arises from the prior consciousness that projects the sense faculty.

original: pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes snga ma las skye bas /
analyzed: pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes snga ma las skye bas /
translated: This consciousness arises from a prior capacity.🔽This capacity arises from the prior consciousness that projects the sense faculty.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo brgyud pa 'di ni thog ma med pa'i dus can nyid yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo brgyud pa 'di ni thog ma med pa'i dus can nyid yin no //
translated: This continuum of cause and effect has existed since beginningless time.

original: de ltar na re zhig dbang po'i nus pa dang / rnam par shes pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig dbang po'i nus pa dang / rnam par shes pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the capacity of the sense faculty and consciousness have been demonstrated to be the relationship of cause and effect.

original: 'di gnyis kyang phan tshun gyi rgyu can dang / thog ma med pa'i dus pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyang phan tshun gyi rgyu can dang / thog ma med pa'i dus pa yin te /
translated: These two are mutually causal and have existed since beginningless time.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di kho nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di kho nas /
translated: This very statement

original: yul gyi nus pa dang rnam par shes pa phan tshun rgyu mtshan nyid dang / thog ma med pa'i dus can nyid du ston to //
analyzed: yul gyi nus pa dang rnam par shes pa phan tshun rgyu mtshan nyid dang / thog ma med pa'i dus can nyid du ston to //
translated: demonstrates that the capacity of the object and consciousness are mutually causal and have existed since beginningless time.

original: phan tshun gyi rgyu can nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phan tshun gyi rgyu can nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that they are mutually causal,

original: res 'ga' ni nus pa yongs su smin pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni nus pa yongs su smin pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it says, “Sometimes, from the ripening of the capacity,” and so on.

original: res 'ga' ni spros pa'i bag chags zhes bya ba'i nus pa yongs su smin pa las rnam par shes pa'i yul gyi rnam pa nyid du 'byung la /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni spros pa'i bag chags zhes bya ba'i nus pa yongs su smin pa las rnam par shes pa'i yul gyi rnam pa nyid du 'byung la /
translated: Sometimes, from the ripening of the capacity called the latent propensities, the aspect of the object of consciousness arises.

original: res 'ga' ni yul gyi rnam pa can gyi sems las nus pa skye'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni yul gyi rnam pa can gyi sems las nus pa skye'o //
translated: Sometimes, the potency arises from the mind that has the aspect of the object.

original: 'di la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i brgyud pa 'di'i rgyun chad pa med pas thog ma med pa'i dus can nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i brgyud pa 'di'i rgyun chad pa med pas thog ma med pa'i dus can nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: And in this case, too, since there is no interruption in the continuum of this causal process, it should be understood that it has existed since beginningless time.

original: yang ci dbang po dang yul gyi nus pa 'di dag rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa zhig yin nam /
analyzed: yang ci dbang po dang yul gyi nus pa 'di dag rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa zhig yin nam /
translated: Now, are these potencies of the sense faculties and objects different from consciousness?

original: 'on te ma yin /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin /
translated: Or are they not?

original: gal te tha dad pa na de'i tshe ming tsam zhig la ldog par rtogs par zad kyi don ni mthun te /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa na de'i tshe ming tsam zhig la ldog par rtogs par zad kyi don ni mthun te /
translated: If they are different, then it is merely a matter of a different name, but the meaning is the same,

original: rnam par shes pa la ma gtogs pa'i dbang po dang / dmigs pa dag khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //🔽'on te tha mi dad na ni de'i tshe nus pa 'di ni dbang po'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la ma gtogs pa'i dbang po dang / dmigs pa dag khas blangs pa'i phyir ro // 'on te tha mi dad na ni de'i tshe nus pa 'di ni dbang po'o //
translated: because you accept sense faculties and objects that are not included in consciousness.

original: 'di ni yul lo zhes bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa 'dir mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni yul lo zhes bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa 'dir mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if they are not different, then at that time, it would not be possible to posit that this is a sense faculty and that is an object.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa dang / de gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa dang / de gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “If consciousness and those two are not different,” and so on.

original: gal te dngos kyi tshul dpyad na ni /
analyzed: gal te dngos kyi tshul dpyad na ni /
translated: If one analyzes the mode of being of the entities,

original: de'i tshe nus pa rnams gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyi bdag nyid yin pas kun rdzob tu yod pa'i phyir /🔽rnam par shes pa las gzhan nyid dam /
analyzed: de'i tshe nus pa rnams gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyi bdag nyid yin pas kun rdzob tu yod pa'i phyir / rnam par shes pa las gzhan nyid dam /
translated: then the potencies are conventionally existent because they are the nature of a specific state.

original: gzhan ma yin pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they cannot be said to be different from consciousness or not different.

original: de'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i nyes pa gnyi gar thal ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i nyes pa gnyi gar thal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, the consequence of both faults that were stated does not apply.

original: 'on te 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la brten na ni //
analyzed: 'on te 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la brten na ni //
translated: But if one relies on worldly convention,

original: de'i tshe ci dgar res 'ga' ni rnam par shes pa de dag las gzhan pa nyid du brjod par bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i tshe ci dgar res 'ga' ni rnam par shes pa de dag las gzhan pa nyid du brjod par bya ba la /
translated: then at that time, sometimes those potencies can be said to be different from consciousness,

original: res 'ga' ni gzhan ma yin pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni gzhan ma yin pa nyid du'o //
translated: and sometimes they cannot be said to be different.

original: 'di ltar kun rdzob tu yod pa rnams ni 'jig rten na res 'ga' ni tha dad par tha snyad 'dogs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar kun rdzob tu yod pa rnams ni 'jig rten na res 'ga' ni tha dad par tha snyad 'dogs te /
translated: Thus, those that exist conventionally are sometimes designated as different in the world,

original: @187b dper na tsan dan gyi dri zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: @187b dper na tsan dan gyi dri zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: as in the case of the expression “the smell of sandalwood.”

original: res 'ga' ni tha mi dad pa ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni tha mi dad pa ste /
translated: Sometimes they are designated as not different,🔽as in the case of the expression “the color of sandalwood.”

original: dper na gzugs la sogs pa la bum pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gzugs la sogs pa la bum pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like a pot in relation to form and so on.

original: de ltar phyogs gnyi ga la yang dmigs pa nang gi yin par bstan nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar phyogs gnyi ga la yang dmigs pa nang gi yin par bstan nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having taught that the object is internal in both cases, he concludes:

original: de ltar na nang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar na nang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, the internal, etc.

original: de ltar na bshad pa'i rnam pas rnam par shes pa dang tha mi dad pa'i dmigs pa la chos nyid gnyis dang ldan pa yod pas yul nyid du 'thad pa yin no //🔽dmigs pa yongs su brtag pa yi //
analyzed: de ltar na bshad pa'i rnam pas rnam par shes pa dang tha mi dad pa'i dmigs pa la chos nyid gnyis dang ldan pa yod pas yul nyid du 'thad pa yin no // dmigs pa yongs su brtag pa yi //
translated: Thus, the object is tenable as an object because it exists as the reality that is not different from consciousness in the way that it has been explained.🔽The commentary on the examination of the object

original: rnam par 'grel pa gsal byas pas //
analyzed: rnam par 'grel pa gsal byas pas //
translated: has been clarified.

original: dge ba thob pa gang yin des //
analyzed: dge ba thob pa gang yin des //
translated: By whatever virtue I have obtained,🔽may beings attain buddhahood.

original: 'gro ba sangs rgyas nyid thob shog / dang po'i las can dga' bya'i phyir //
analyzed: 'gro ba sangs rgyas nyid thob shog / dang po'i las can dga' bya'i phyir //
translated: In order to delight beginners,

original: rgya cher bshad pa dul ba'i lhas //
analyzed: rgya cher bshad pa dul ba'i lhas //
translated: Vinītadeva has composed this extensive commentary

original: khams bcu dang ni bral bar byas //
analyzed: khams bcu dang ni bral bar byas //
translated: free from the ten faults.

original: de phyir mkhas rnams bzod par gyis //
analyzed: de phyir mkhas rnams bzod par gyis //

analyzed: 'di ni 'dod 'dod dpyad du med //
translated: should not examine this as they wish.

original: rang gi rnam rtog dbang gis na //
analyzed: rang gi rnam rtog dbang gis na //
translated: It is through the power of one’s own thoughts

original: nyes pa med pa'am blo la snang //🔽dmigs pa brtag pa rgya cher bshad pa slob dpon dul ba'i lha shes bya'i dmigs pa mtha' dag la gzhol ba smra ba'i seng ge mu stegs can glang po che'i glang pa 'gi mas par mdzad pas sbyar ba rdzogs so /

translated: That the faults appear or do not appear to the mind.🔽This concludes the extensive explanation of the examination of the object, composed by the master Vinītadeva, the lion among expounders, who is devoted to all objects of knowledge, and who has crushed the elephants of the tīrthikas.
